%r@n%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@r%r@—%r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@d%r@e%r@a%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@N%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@l%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@c%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@“%R@H%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@a%r@w%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@(%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@?%r@ %R@O%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@o%r@g%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@m%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@p%r@s%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@g%r@g%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@-%r@y%r@i%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@m%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@k%r@y%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@3He kept speaking the word of God to them by means of many analogies such as these, doing it to the degree that they continued to be able to make sense of what he was saying. %u@3%u@4And, apart from analogies, he wasn’t telling them anything. But he explained everything to his own disciples when they were by themselves.%vn~
          %u@3%u@5When it got to be late in the day, he prompted them, %r@“%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@r%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@3%u@6After dismissing the crowd they joined up with him as he was already in the boat they planned to use. Other boats were alongside it. %u@3%u@7A windstorm appeared, and the waves kept crashing on the boat, enough to fill it. %u@3%u@8He, though, was in the stern sleeping on the cushions. They woke him and sought to engage him, “Teacher, don’t you care that we’re dying here?” %u@3%u@9And he got up and sternly silenced the wind and said to the sea, %r@“%R@Q%r@u%r@i%r@e%r@t%r@—%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@f%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@!%r@”%r@ And the wind died down and a great calm appeared. %u@4%u@0He said to them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@n%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@?%r@” %u@4%u@1They were dumbfounded with awe and reverence and started saying to one another, “So now, who is this guy, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”%vn~
%sb~
Mark Chapter 5%hb~
          %u@1He got to the other side of the sea, to the Gerasenes region. %u@2Right away, while he was still getting out of the boat, from out of the tombs a man having a demonic spirit accosted him, %u@3who lived there in the tombs. No one had the ability to chain him up anymore, %u@4on account of him, many times, having his arms secured in chains and his feet in stocks and breaking out of the chains and stocks after shredding them to pieces—no one was powerful enough to restrain him. %u@5Day and night he was up in the tombs and in the mountains screaming and cutting himself up with stones. %u@6Seeing Jesus from a distance, he ran and prostrated himself before him %u@7and yelled in a loud voice, “I have no beef with you, Jesus, son of the Highest God! In God’s name I’m begging you—don’t torment me!” %u@8…since he was about to say to him, %r@“%R@C%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@!%r@” %u@9He asked him, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@?%r@”%r@ He replied, “My name’s ‘Regiment’, since there’s a lot of us.” %u@1%u@0He was pleading with him a good deal, so that he wouldn’t send them outside the region. %u@1%u@1Now, there was a huge herd of pigs feeding there at the mountain. %u@1%u@2They begged him, “Send us over to the pigs, so that we can enter them.” %u@1%u@3He permitted them, and the regiment of foul spirits departed and entered the pigs, and the herd bolted over the cliff and into the sea—about two thousand of them—and drowned in the sea.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Those feeding them proceeded to run away, and they told everyone in the city and in the countryside, and they came to see what happened. %u@1%u@5They went to where Jesus was and observed the demon-possessed man sitting, clothed, and in a sound state of mind—the one who had the regiment—and they got scared. %u@1%u@6They described to those who came to look around what happened to the demon-possessed man and about the pigs. %u@1%u@7They began to plead with him to leave their mountains. %u@1%u@8While he was boarding the boat, the demon-possessed man asked if he could be with him from then on, %u@1%u@9but he didn’t allow it, but instead instructed him, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@k%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@r%r@c%r@y%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@0He left and began to preach what Jesus did for him in Decapolis, and everyone was in awe.%vn~
          %u@2%u@1Again, Jesus crossed over in the boat to the other side, and a large crowd converged on him, while he was still near the sea. %u@2%u@2One of the synagogue leaders named Jairus came, and, seeing him, fell at his feet %u@2%u@3and went to pleading with him a great deal, saying, “My baby’s at death’s door,” in order that he would come and put his hand on her, so that she would be spared and would live. %u@2%u@4He left with him, and a huge crowd began to follow him and was constantly pressing in on him.%vn~
          %u@2%u@5A woman who had a hemorrhage for twelve years, %u@2%u@6having suffered a great deal at the hands of many doctors, spending everything she had—and nothing was helping but instead things were trending more to the worse— %u@2%u@7heard about Jesus, came up behind him in the crowd and touched his outer cloak, %u@2%u@8since she kept on saying to herself, “If I were to just touch his cloak, I‘ll pull through.” %u@2%u@9Her hemorrhage stopped immediately, and her body told her that she had been healed from this calamity of illness. %u@3%u@0Right away Jesus, having discerned in himself that miraculous power had proceeded out of him, turned to the crowd and said repeatedly, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@r%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@?%r@” %u@3%u@1The disciples proceeded to say, “You see the crowd pressing in on you and you’re asking, ‘Who touched me?’” %u@3%u@2He looked around to see who did this. %u@3%u@3Now the woman, scared and trembling, aware of what had happened to her, came and fell before him and told him the whole truth. %u@3%u@4He said to her, %r@“%R@M%r@a%r@’%r@a%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@.%r@ %R@C%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@(%r@i%r@.%r@e%r@.%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@f%r@l%r@i%r@c%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@f%r@l%r@i%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@)%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@u%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@a%r@m%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@l%r@l%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@5While he was yet still talking, someone from the synagogue leader’s household arrived saying, “Your daughter’s dead; no need for you to bother the teacher anymore.” %u@3%u@6Now Jesus, having listened in to the report as it was being spoken, addresses the synagogue ruler, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@—%r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@3%u@7He wouldn’t let anyone accompany him, except for Peter, James, and his brother John. %u@3%u@8He came to the synagogue leader’s house, and he sees commotion, weeping, and much lamentation, %u@3%u@9and he entered and gaining their attention said, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@o%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@4%u@0They began to ridicule him. He, though, threw everyone out and took the child’s mother and father and those with him and went in to where the child was. %u@4%u@1He took the child’s hand and said to her, %r@“%R@T%r@a%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@ %r@k%r@o%r@u%r@m%r@!%r@”%r@ which translated means, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@:%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@!%r@” %u@4%u@2Immediately the girl got up and began to walk around, since she was twelve years old. Immediately, out of enormous delight, they lost it. %u@4%u@3He left orders with them, going over them in detail, not to make this known to anyone, and he told them to give her something to eat.%vn~
%sb~
Mark Chapter 6%hb~
          %u@1He departed from there and came to his hometown, and his disciples followed him. %u@2On a Saturday, the Sabbath, he began to teach in the synagogue, and many of the listeners were amazed saying, “Where did he get these things from, and who bestowed the wisdom on him, and who gave his hands the ability to perform such miracles as these? %u@3Isn’t this fellow the craftsman, Mary’s son and James, Joses, Juda, and Simon’s brother? Aren’t his sisters from around here?” And they took aversion to him. %u@4He was saying to them that a prophet isn’t honored in his hometown, in his synagogues, and in his own home, %u@5and he couldn’t perform a single miracle there, except for healing a few ailments, by laying his hands on a few people. %u@6He was astonished at their refusal to believe.%vn~
      He went around teaching in the surrounding towns, %u@7and he summoned the Twelve and began to send them out in pairs, gave them authority over demonic spirits, %u@8and charged them not to take anything on the road with them except a staff only—no food, no backpack, no spare cash; %u@9moreover, he told them to be sure to show up wearing sandals and to refrain from putting on two sets of undergarments. %u@1%u@0He continued speaking to them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@t%r@t%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@f%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@t%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@2They dispersed and preached with the goal in mind of having people fundamentally change the way they conduct their lives. %u@1%u@3Time and time again they cast out many demons and applied soothing oil to many people who had ailments, and one after another was being healed.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Now King Herod heard the news, since his reputation was spreading. They were saying that John the Baptist rose from the dead, and this is the means by which the miracles are accomplished by him. %u@1%u@5Others were saying that he’s Elijah. Still others were saying that he’s a prophet like one of the prophets in the Old Testament. %u@1%u@6After Herod heard all of this, he started going around saying, “The guy I personally beheaded—John—that’s who was resurrected.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@7The fact is, Herod himself had dispatched his men and had John taken into custody and locked him up in jail on account of his brother Philip’s wife Herodias, because he had married her; %u@1%u@8you see, John had been telling Herod that it’s not permissible for him to be married to his brother’s wife. %u@1%u@9So Herodias maintained a grudge against him and was wanting to kill him, and wasn’t yet able to do so, %u@2%u@0since, throughout, Herod had a reverential awe of John, knowing him to be an upstanding man, right in the eyes of God and holy, and was keeping him safe. After listening to him many times, he became conflicted, yet still enjoyed listening to him.%vn~
          %u@2%u@1There came a day when the opportunity presented itself, when, on Herod’s birthday, she prepared a special dinner for his gentry, for the high-ranking army officers, and for the top leaders of Galilee. %u@2%u@2Herodias’s daughter entered and danced and pleased Herod and his fellow dinner guests. The king said to the young miss, “Whatever you want, ask me, and I’ll give it to you.” %u@2%u@3He swore up and down to her multiple times, “Whatever you ask me for, I’ll give it to you—anything you want—anything at all.” %u@2%u@4She excused herself and said to her mother, “What should I ask for?” Her mother said, “John the Baptist’s head.” %u@2%u@5Straightaway she rejoined the party and with hasty eagerness said, “I want you to give me John the Baptist’s head on a platter—right now.” %u@2%u@6From head to toe the king became deeply sorry, but because of the promises and the dinner guests didn’t want to deny her request. %u@2%u@7The king ordered that his head be brought in at once. They went out and beheaded him in jail %u@2%u@8and brought his head on a platter and gave it to the young miss, who gave it to her mother. %u@2%u@9When his disciples heard about this, they came and took away his body and placed it in a tomb.%vn~
          %u@3%u@0Now the disciples assembled back where Jesus was at and told him what they did and what they taught. %u@3%u@1He comforted them, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@b%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@t%r@,” since a lot of people were coming and going, and they couldn’t find a moment to have a meal. %u@3%u@2So they left by themselves in the boat to go to a remote location. %u@3%u@3They were seen departing, and a lot of people figured out where they were going and came out of all the cities and, in one pack, ran and got there ahead of them. %u@3%u@4Departing, he saw a large crowd and felt sorry for them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd, and began to teach them many things. %u@3%u@5Much of the day had already passed by, and the disciples came to him and proceeded to say,%vn~
      “We’re out in the middle of nowhere and it’s getting late. %u@3%u@6Disperse them, so that they can go out into the surrounding countryside and towns and buy something to eat.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@7His response to that was, %r@“%R@G%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@”%vn~
      They, in turn, said, “So, now, we go out and buy $20,000 worth of bread and distribute it?”%vn~
          %u@3%u@8He, in turn, said, %r@“%R@H%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@?%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@.%r@”%vn~
      They counted it up and gave him the results, “Five loaves and two fishes.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@9He had them find a nice spot to relax%u@ where the grass was tall and had them break up into dinner parties. %u@4%u@0They seated themselves in lots of hundreds and fifties. %u@4%u@1He took the five loaves and the two fishes, looked up in the sky, gave thanks, broke the bread, and gave it to his disciples for them to go about placing it within their reach. %u@4%u@2Everyone ate to their full, %u@4%u@3and there were twelve basketfuls of bread scraps and fish left over. %u@4%u@4There were five thousand grown men there eating that day.%vn~
          %u@4%u@5Right away, the disciples had to get into the boat and head out before him to the other side, to Bethsaida, while he dismissed the crowd. %u@4%u@6He took his leave of them and hiked up into the mountain to pray. %u@4%u@7Near sundown, the boat was out in the middle of the sea, while he was by himself on land. %u@4%u@8Watching them struggling to row, since they were up against a contrary wind, around four o’clock in the morning, he came to them walking on the water and was going to pass them by. %u@4%u@9Upon seeing him walking about on the water, they thought it was a ghost and shouted out loud; %u@5%u@0indeed, everyone saw him and was terrified. Immediately he engaged them in conversation saying, %r@“%R@R%r@e%r@l%r@a%r@x%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@.%r@” %u@5%u@1He went over to where they were and got into the boat, and the wind died down. They were completely stupefied, %u@5%u@2since they hadn’t put all the pieces together in regard to the incident of the bread, and, what’s more, their hearts had been hardened.%vn~
          %u@5%u@3Having crossed over to land, they came to Gennesaret and docked. %u@5%u@4As they were getting out of the boat, people immediately recognized him. %u@5%u@5Everyone from%u@ that whole region there rushed around the lake to see him, and they proceeded to carry around the lake on cots those who had something wrong with them, wherever it was being reported that he was at. %u@5%u@6And whatever place he were to enter—a town, a city, a place in the countryside—they were placing those having illnesses in the town square, and they were begging him if they could just touch a part of his clothing, and whoever were to touch a part of it would be snatched away from the clutches of their illness.%vn~
%sb~
Mark Chapter 7%hb~
          %u@1The Pharisees and some of the designed teachers came from Jerusalem and congregated around him. %u@2They were observing some of his disciples taking their meals with defiled hands (that is, with unwashed hands), %u@3since the Pharisees and all the Jews won’t eat if they haven’t washed their hands up to their wrists, adhering to the time-honored traditions, %u@4and if they come from the marketplace or the town square, they won’t eat until they take a ceremonial bath; plus they adhere to many more things that have been handed down through the years…the ceremonial washing of wine chalices, of jugs, of utensils— %u@5and the Pharisees and designated teachers asked him, “Why is it that your disciples aren’t in the habit of observing the time-honored traditions, but eat their meals with tainted hands?” %u@6He said, %r@“%R@I%r@s%r@a%r@i%r@a%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@y%r@p%r@o%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@—%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@:%r@%vn~
%r@%si~
%r@“%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@ %R@M%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@p%r@s%r@%vp~
%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@%vp~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %R@M%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@v%r@a%r@i%r@l%r@%vp~

%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@”%R@A%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@o%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@j%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@d%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@a%r@d%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@N%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@F%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@r%r@e%r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@a%r@d%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@.%r@”%nn~
          %u@1%u@4He summoned the crowd and kept with the subject, saying, %r@“%R@E%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@h%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@;%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@c%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@”%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%vn~
          %u@1%u@7When he entered a house, away from the crowd, his disciples started asking him about the illustration. %u@1%u@8He said to them, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@?%r@ %R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@(%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@b%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@l%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@)%r@?%r@” %u@2%u@0He continued on saying, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@u%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@c%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@I%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@n%r@i%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@…%r@s%r@e%r@x%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@m%r@o%r@r%r@a%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@a%r@d%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@u%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@u%r@p%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@s%r@l%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@-%r@o%r@f%r@-%r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@o%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@a%r@s%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@d%r@-%r@m%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@o%r@g%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@k%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@u%r@p%r@i%r@d%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@A%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@i%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@c%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@4He wrapped things up there and left for the region of Tyre. He entered a house, since he wasn’t wanting to have direct contact with anyone. %u@2%u@5But instead, without delay a woman who had a daughter who was overcome with having a demonic spirit heard about him and came and fell at his feet. %u@2%u@6But the woman was a non-Jew, a Syro-Phoenician by nationality. She drove home her point asking him if he’d cast the demon out of his daughter. %u@2%u@7And he drove home his point saying to her,%vn~
      %r@“%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@g%r@s%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@8But after some thought she replied, “Lord, even the dogs groveling under the table are fed from the children’s crumbs.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@9He said to her, %r@“%R@O%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@0After arriving back home, she found the child bedfast and the demon gone for good.%vn~
          %u@3%u@1Again, he left Tyre and went through Sidon to the Sea of Galilee, to the central area of Decapolis. %u@3%u@2They brought him a man who was deaf and who could barely speak, and they asked him to lay his hand on him. %u@3%u@3He took him aside, in order to be away from the crowd and to have some privacy, and he stuck his fingers in his ears, and, after he spat, touched all around his tongue. %u@3%u@4He looked up in the sky, let out a groan from deep within, and said to him %r@“%R@E%r@f%r@f%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@!%r@”, which means, %r@“%R@B%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@!%r@”. %u@3%u@5His hearing was restored, and his speaking impairment was broken, and he began to speak correctly. %u@3%u@6He gave them orders, in no uncertain terms, not to tell anyone, but the more he would leave orders, the more they went about spreading the word to others. %u@3%u@7They were continuously overflowing with amazement saying, “All the good he’s accomplished—he even makes the deaf hear and the dumb speak.”%vn~
%sb~
Mark Chapter 8%hb~
          %u@1Around that time, a huge crowd had formed yet again. As they didn’t have anything to eat, he summoned his disciples and engages them thus, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@”%R@I%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@e%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@I%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@a%r@p%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@;%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4They replied, “Where can any of these people here get enough food to eat out in the middle of nowhere?”%vn~
          %u@5He asked, %r@“%R@H%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@?%r@”%vn~
      They said, “Seven loaves.”%vn~
          %u@6He told the crowd to find a spot on the ground to relax, and he took the seven loaves, gave thanks, broke them, and began to hand them to his disciples, so that they would place them within reach of the crowd; and they distributed them. %u@7They had a few fishes too, and after consecrating them, he said for them to be distributed as well. %u@8They ate until they were full, and there were seven basketfuls of leftover scraps and pieces. %u@9Now there were four thousand men there, and he dispersed them. %u@1%u@0Immediately, he got into the boat with his disciples and went to Dalmanutha.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1The Pharisees came out and began to question him, looking for a spectacular miracle. %u@1%u@2He groaned in his spirit and uttered, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@a%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@Z%r@e%r@i%r@t%r@g%r@e%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@a%r@c%r@u%r@l%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@l%r@e%r@?%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@3He left them, yet again got into the boat, and went to the other side.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Except for one loaf, they forgot to take any bread along with them in the boat. %u@1%u@5He proceeded to open up with them about what was on his mind, %r@“%R@L%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@P%r@h%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@e%r@s%r@’%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@r%r@o%r@d%r@i%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@’%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@6They went over this again and again with one another, since they didn’t have any bread. %u@1%u@7Knowing this, he addressed them, %r@“%R@A%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@c%r@u%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@c%r@l%r@u%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@?%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@g%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@?%r@ %R@A%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@W%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@y%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@?%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@m%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@d%r@i%r@c%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@f%r@t%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@s%r@k%r@e%r@t%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@c%r@r%r@a%r@p%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@?%r@—%r@t%r@w%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@d%r@i%r@c%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@s%r@k%r@e%r@t%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@c%r@r%r@a%r@p%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@?%r@—%r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@1He continued speaking, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@?%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2He arrived at Bethsaida. They brought him a blind man and begged him to touch him. %u@2%u@3He took the blind man’s hand and brought him outside of the town, spat on his eyes, laid his hands on him, and asked him, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@4He opened his eyes, looked about, and said repeatedly, “I’m looking at the people here, because I see tree-like objects walking around.” %u@2%u@5Yet again he laid his hands on his eyes, and his vision was restored completely, and he was seeing clearly at a distance. %u@2%u@6He sent him home saying, %r@“%R@P%r@l%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@7Jesus and his disciples left for the town of Caesarea, Philippi. On the way, he asked his disciples, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@8They said, “John the Baptist…others say Elijah…still others say one of the prophets like in the Old Testament.” %u@2%u@9He asked the question, coming from himself, %r@“%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@—%r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@l%r@s%r@e%r@—%r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@?%r@”%r@ %R@P%r@e%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@q%r@u%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@s%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@“You are the Messiah, the Christ.” %u@3%u@0He sternly commanded them not to tell anyone about him.%vn~
          %u@3%u@1He began to explain to them that the Man must endure a good amount of suffering and be rejected by the high court, the chief priests, and the designated teachers, will be killed, and will rise from the dead after three days. %u@3%u@2He was speaking this fact plainly. Peter cornered him and began to reprimand him. %u@3%u@3He turned and, looking at his disciples, scolded Peter, “Take a hike,%u@ you minion of Satan! You’re not exercising common-sense wisdom in the things of God—see—but rather the things of mankind.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@4He summoned the crowd to join him and his disciples and said to them, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@r%r@o%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@;%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@r%r@o%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %R@N%r@e%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@F%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@F%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@F%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@h%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@a%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@Z%r@e%r@i%r@t%r@g%r@e%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@d%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@w%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@s%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@h%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@l%r@s%r@.%r@”%vn~
%sb~
Mark Chapter 9%hb~
%u@1He continued speaking to them: %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@(%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@v%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@l%r@u%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@u%r@l%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%nn~
          %u@2Six days later, Jesus took Peter, James, and John with him and brought them to a high mountain, by themselves, and he transformed himself in their presence. %u@3His clothing shined a bright white, in a way like no sort of bleach on this planet can whiten. %u@4Elijah and Moses together as a pair appeared to them, and they were having a conversation with Jesus. %u@5Peter thought a bit and said to Jesus, “Jesus—good thing we’re here with you. We’ll make three little holy edifices: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.” %u@6The fact is, he didn’t know what to say; they had become terrified indeed. %u@7A cloud appeared, engulfing them in a shadow, and a voice appeared out of the cloud, “This is my Beloved Son: listen to him%u@ again and again.” %u@8Suddenly, they looked around and didn’t see anyone else with them except for Jesus only.%vn~
          %u@9While they were descending the mountain, he ordered them not to repeat in detail what had happened to anyone, except after the Man is resurrected from the dead. %u@1%u@0They kept the matter to themselves, discussing with one another what to be “resurrected from the dead” means. %u@1%u@1Questioning him, they said, “Why is it that the designated teachers say that Elijah has to come first?” %u@1%u@2In the course of telling them he said, %r@“%R@S%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@—%R@E%r@l%r@i%r@j%r@a%r@h%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@;%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@u%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@A%r@n%r@y%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@—%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@E%r@l%r@i%r@j%r@a%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Having arrived back at where his disciples were, they saw that a huge crowd had surrounded them and that designated teachers were arguing with them. %u@1%u@5Straightaway, the entire crowd, seeing them, got in a tizzy, rushed over, and began to hail him. %u@1%u@6He asked, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@m%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@?%r@”%u@1%u@7Someone in the crowd answered, “Teacher, I brought my son, who has a demonic spirit of muteness, to you. %u@1%u@8Whenever it takes control of him, it throws him on the ground, and he foams at the mouth and gnashes his teeth, and he goes rigid, tucking into a fetal position. I spoke to your disciples so that they would cast it out, and they weren’t able to.” %u@1%u@9He answered, %r@“%R@O%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@a%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@Z%r@e%r@i%r@t%r@g%r@e%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@!%r@ %R@H%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@?%r@ %R@H%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@?%r@—%R@B%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@0They brought him to him, and seeing him, the spirit immediately caused him to go into convulsions, drop to the ground, and roll around foaming at the mouth. %u@2%u@1He asked his father, %r@“%R@H%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@?” He said, “Since childhood. %u@2%u@2Another thing…a lot of times he throws him into fire and into water, in order to destroy him—so now, if you can do anything, have a heart and help me out here.” %u@2%u@3Jesus said to him, %r@“%R@A%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@‘%r@i%r@f%r@-%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@-%r@c%r@a%r@n%r@-%r@d%r@o%r@-%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@’%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@:%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@4Immediately the boy’s father began to say over and over, “I believe—help me with my unbelief!” %u@2%u@5Now Jesus, seeing that the crowd rushed on over to join them, dropped the hammer on the demonic spirit, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@:%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@6He screamed and shook him with one last convulsion and came out. He was laid out like a dead body, so much so that many were going around saying that he died. %u@2%u@7Jesus grabbed his hand and pulled him up, and he stood up. %u@2%u@8After they got to be alone in a house, his disciples asked him, “Why is it that we couldn’t cast it out?” %u@2%u@9He said, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@y%r@p%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@c%r@e%r@p%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@0They left there and started going throughout Galilee, and all the while didn’t want to have any interaction with anyone, %u@3%u@1since he kept on working at getting his disciples up to speed, saying repeatedly, %r@“%R@P%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@3%u@2They weren’t making any sense of the remark and all the while were afraid to ask him about it.%vn~
          %u@3%u@3They went to Capernaum. When they got back home, he asked, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@g%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@?%r@” %u@3%u@4They kept quiet, since on the way over they were trying to figure out who among them was number-one. %u@3%u@5He took a seat, called the Twelve over, and engages them, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@s%r@u%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@3%u@6He took a child, stood him in front of them, put his arm around him, and told them, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%r@”%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %R@C%r@h%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@u%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@8John said to him, “Teacher, we saw a guy casting out demons, assuming to do so under your authority, and we intervened and prevented him from doing it, because he’s not one of our trainees nor is he affiliated with us.” %u@3%u@9Jesus said, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@q%r@u%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@u%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@d%r@-%r@m%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@v%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@I%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@u%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %R@C%r@h%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@”%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@a%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@e%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@y%r@e%r@ %r@(%r@i%r@.%r@e%r@.%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@u%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@c%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@)%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@:%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@
