%r@h%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@e%r@y%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@a%r@s%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@f%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@.%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%r@”%R@F%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@l%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@S%r@a%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@l%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@s%r@?%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@m%r@b%r@e%r@d%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@;%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
%sb~
Mark Chapter 10%hb~
          %u@1He headed out from there and went to the Judean area, on the other side of the Jordan River, and a crowd gathered around him again, and he began teaching them again per usual. %u@2Some Pharisees went up to him and started asking if it’s legal for a husband to divorce his wife, trying to catch him in a mistake. %u@3His reply to them was, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@4They said, “The Old Testament allows you ‘…to write a divorce certificate and cut her loose’.” %u@5Jesus said, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@-%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@s%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@O%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@v%r@i%r@d%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@j%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@0When they got back home again, the disciples asked him about this. %u@1%u@1He tells them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@(%r@i%r@.%r@e%r@.%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@v%r@o%r@r%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@)%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@i%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@d%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@s%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@i%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@d%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@1%u@3They brought children to him for him to affect through touch, but his disciples scolded them. %u@1%u@4Seeing this, Jesus became indignant and said to them, %r@“%R@E%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@(%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@a%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@:%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@c%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@6He put his arms around them and pronounced a blessing over them while laying his hands on them.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7While venturing out on the road, someone ran up, fell to his knees before him, and asked him,%vn~
      “Good teacher, what do I have to do to lay claim to that special fullness of life (eternal life)?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@8Jesus said, “Why do you call me ‘good’? Nobody’s good except for one person: God. %u@1%u@9You know the commandments…do not murder…do not commit adultery…don’t steal…don’t lie when called on to make a statement for the record…don’t rip each other off…honor your mother and father.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@0So he said, “Teacher, I’ve been vigilant to keep all of these since I was a teenager.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@1So Jesus stared at him and felt an appreciation for the great value of his life and said, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@:%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2Now he became melancholy over this remark and departed with a sulk, since he owned a lot of stuff. %u@2%u@3Jesus looked around and mused to his disciples, %r@“%R@H%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@f%r@f%r@i%r@c%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@u%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@(%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@4His disciples were simply stunned by this statement. But again Jesus, from out of his contemplation, said to them, %r@“%R@B%r@o%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@f%r@f%r@i%r@c%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@s%r@i%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@a%r@w%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@m%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@6But still in a state of shock, they say to one another, “And how can anyone be kept from this?” %u@2%u@7Jesus stared at them and declares, %r@“%R@W%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@—%r@c%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@;%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@8Peter proceeded to say to him, “Look—we for our part left everything so that we could become your followers.” %u@2%u@9Jesus said, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@:%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@b%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@f%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@h%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %R@N%r@e%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@—%r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@e%r@—%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@h%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@s%r@—%r@a%r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@c%r@u%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@(%r@e%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@)%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@2They were on their way over to Jerusalem, and Jesus was leading the pack. They were all the while stunned: those following his lead were in a state of fear. Confiding in the Twelve, he began to go over with them what would happen to him, the things in motion that were converging. %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@”%r@…%R@B%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@J%r@e%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@r%r@e%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@g%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@o%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@5James and John, the sons of Zebedee, wandered over to him and said to him,%vn~
       “Teacher, we want to ask a favor of you.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@6He said, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@?%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@7They said, “Let one of us be your number-one man and the other your number-two when you’re invested in your regal power.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@8Jesus said, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@d%r@e%r@a%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@.%r@ %R@C%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@?%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@9They said, “We can.”%vn~
      Jesus said, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@-%r@t%r@w%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@1Once they heard about this, the ten became furious with James and John. %u@4%u@2Jesus called them over and tells them, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@b%r@j%r@u%r@g%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@p%r@u%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@m%r@a%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@v%r@a%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@s%r@o%r@l%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@;%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@m%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@,%r@ %r@v%r@a%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@-%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@s%r@e%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@-%r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@y%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@6They came to Jericho, and while he, his disciples, and a sizeable crowd were departing Jericho, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus by name, a blind beggar, was sitting alongside the road. %u@4%u@7Having heard that Jesus of Nazareth was the reason for the crowd, he began to cry out repeatedly, saying,%vn~
      “Jesus, you marvelous godsend, have pity on me!”%vn~
          %u@4%u@8Many scolded him to hush him up, but he cried out all the more, “You marvelous godsend, have pity on me!”%vn~
          %u@4%u@9Jesus stood still and said, %r@“%R@C%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%vn~
      They called for the blind man, saying to him, “Brace yourself—get up, he’s calling you.”%vn~
          %u@5%u@0He threw off his cloak, shot up, and went to Jesus. %u@5%u@1Jesus answered, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@?%r@”%vn~
      The blind man said, “Teacher—I just want to see again.”%vn~
          %u@5%u@2Jesus said, %r@“%R@G%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@.%r@”%r@ Immediately, he regained his sight and took to the road, as he started being his follower.%vn~
%sb~
Mark Chapter 11%hb~
          %u@1When they neared Jerusalem, arriving at Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, he sent out two of his disciples. %u@2He, giving instructions, says to them, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@r%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@i%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@.%r@ %R@U%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@W%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@?%r@’%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@,%r@’%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@.” %u@4They left and found a colt tied to a gate which was up against the street, and they untied it. %u@5Some people who were standing there proceeded to tell them, “What are you doing, untying the colt?” %u@6They told them what Jesus said, and they left them alone. %u@7They then bring the colt to Jesus, toss their outer garments on it, and he mounted it. %u@8Many people spread their outer garments out on the road, and others spread tall grass out, which was chopped down and brought over from the fields. %u@9Those preceding and those following kept on shouting out,%vn~
%si~
Rescue us!%vp~
Praise be to him who comes at the Lord’s behest.%vp~
%u@1%u@0Praise be to the coming monarchy of our patriarch David.%vp~
Rescue us to the max!%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@1He entered Jerusalem and went into the temple complex and looked around at everything. It being late in the day already, he departed with the Twelve for Bethany. %u@1%u@2The next day, while they were leaving Bethany, %u@1%u@3seeing from a distance a fig tree that was in leaf, he went over to it, if perchance he would find anything nestled in it, and when he got up close to it, he found nothing except for leaves, since figs weren’t in season. %u@1%u@4He considered the situation and said, %r@“%R@N%r@o%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@—%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@—%r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@u%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@i%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@” And his disciples were listening when he said it.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5They then come to Jerusalem. After entering the temple complex, he began to throw out the salesmen and the merchandisers doing business in the temple, and he turned over the tables of the money changers and of those who were seated selling doves. %u@1%u@6He wasn’t letting anyone transport boxes containing merchandise through the temple. %u@1%u@7He was going about instructing them and, as part of doing so, said to them, %r@“%R@H%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@M%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@’%r@?%r@—%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@b%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@1%u@8The chief priests and the designated teachers heard about this and were trying to find a way they could eliminate him; the fact was, the crowd was amazed at his teaching. %u@1%u@9He was in the habit of leaving the city when evening arrived.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0Passing by in the morning, they saw the fig tree shriveled up from the roots on up. %u@2%u@1Peter recalled the incident and as a result says, “Teacher, look—the fig tree which you cursed is all shriveled up.” %u@2%u@2Jesus, considering what happened, replied to them, %r@“%R@H%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@-%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@—%r@i%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@B%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@,%r@’%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@u%r@b%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@O%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@:%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@6%vn~
          %u@2%u@7He went to Jerusalem again. While he was walking about the temple compound, the chief priests, the designated teachers, and the councilmen approached him. %u@2%u@8They started speaking to him,%vn~
      “By what authority do you do these things? In other words, who gave you the authority to do these things?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@9Jesus said, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@s%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@q%r@u%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@s%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@J%r@o%r@h%r@n%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@p%r@t%r@i%r@s%r@m%r@:%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@p%r@t%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@?%r@—%R@A%r@n%r@s%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@1They talked it over amongst themselves, saying, “If we say ‘From heaven’, he’ll say, ‘Then why didn’t you believe in him?’ %u@3%u@2But if we say, ‘From mankind,’…”—They feared the crowd, since everyone considered John to be a prophet. %u@3%u@3They answered Jesus, “We don’t know.”%vn~
      And Jesus then tells them, %r@“%R@N%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@.%r@”%vn~
%sb~
Mark Chapter 12%hb~
          %u@1He proceeded to speak to them by means of analogy: %r@“%R@A%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@u%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@r%r@o%r@a%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@d%r@u%r@c%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@y%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@A%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@o%r@.%r@ %R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@…%r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@;%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@a%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@?%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@j%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@—%r@%vp~

%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@B%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@%vp~

%u@1%u@2All the while they were seeking to get ahold of him, but were afraid of the crowd, since they knew that the analogy was directed at them. They left him alone and departed.%nn~
          %u@1%u@3They sent some of the Pharisees and some Herod supporters to him in order to catch him making a mistake while conversing. %u@1%u@4They went and said to him, “Teacher, we know that you’re honest and that what you teach is the true way to God and that you could care less what anyone thinks about you, all the more so since you’re not affected by people’s attitudes, but you teach God’s way in a truthful manner. Do we have to pay Caesar the poll tax or not? Shall we pay or not pay?” %u@1%u@5Having a full view of their hypocrisy presented before him, he said,%vn~
      %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@?%r@ %R@B%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@x%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@y%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@1%u@6They brought him one.%vn~
      He then says, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@c%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
      They said, “Caesar’s.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@7Jesus said, %r@“%R@G%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %R@C%r@a%r@e%r@s%r@a%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@C%r@a%r@e%r@s%r@a%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
      They were stunned.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8The Sadducees, who claim that there is no life after death, went up to him and put a question to him, %u@1%u@9”Teacher, the Old Testament says that if someone’s brother dies and leaves a wife behind but didn’t leave a son, his brother will take the woman as his wife for the purpose of producing a male offspring for the sake of his dead brother. %u@2%u@0There were seven brothers. The first got married to a woman and died, not leaving a descendent, %u@2%u@1and the second took her as his wife and died, not leaving a descendent, and the third, and so forth. %u@2%u@2The seven left no descendent. Last of all, the woman died. %u@2%u@3Which of them will she be the wife of in the after-life, since all seven had married her?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@4Jesus said, %r@“%R@I%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@m%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@-%r@b%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@-%r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@e%r@:%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@r%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@A%r@b%r@r%r@a%r@h%r@a%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@s%r@a%r@a%r@c%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@J%r@a%r@c%r@o%r@b%r@.%r@’%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@-%r@b%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@8One of the designated teachers heard them debating and seeing how well he replied to them asked him, “Which is the most important commandment?” %u@2%u@9Jesus answered, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@p%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@H%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@s%r@r%r@a%r@e%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@p%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@b%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@.%r@’%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@3%u@2The designated teacher said to him, “Well-said, teacher, you really hit the nail on the head, since, ‘He is One and there is no other one than Him,’ %u@3%u@3plus the quotation ‘…to love him from the entire heart and from the entire conscience and from the entire strength,’ plus the quotation ‘…to love a neighbor as yourself’ exceeds all burnt offerings and sacrifices.” %u@3%u@4Jesus, seeing that he got it, replied, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@o%r@o%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@l%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@(%r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@.%r@” No one had the guts to ask him anything else any more.%vn~
          %u@3%u@5After some thought, Jesus proceeded to speak, teaching in the temple, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@g%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@a%r@h%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@D%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@o%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@H%r@o%r@l%r@y%r@ %R@S%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@,%r@%vn~
%r@%si~
%r@”%R@A%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@-%r@p%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@%vp~
%R@B%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@%vp~
%R@U%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@b%r@d%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@e%r@m%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@b%r@j%r@u%r@g%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@%vp~
%r@%si~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%r@”%R@D%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@?%r@”%r@ The crowd, which was large, listened to him with delight.%nn~
          %u@3%u@8He continued his teaching by saying to them, %r@“%R@O%r@b%r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@g%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@e%r@t%r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@q%r@u%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@b%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@c%r@c%r@u%r@p%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@g%r@i%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@y%r@n%r@a%r@g%r@o%r@g%r@u%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@n%r@q%r@u%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@b%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@d%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@’%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@-%r@w%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@q%r@u%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@1He seated himself across from the collection basket, and watched and watched people, just what amount of money they were tossing into the basket; the rich people were tossing in great amounts. %u@4%u@2This one widow came and tossed in a couple of dollars. %u@4%u@3He called his disciples over and said, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@d%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@l%r@s%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@i%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@c%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@.%r@”%vn~
%sb~
Mark Chapter 13%hb~
          %u@1While leaving the temple, one of his disciples then says, “Teacher, look—what breathtaking stones and edifices.” %u@2Jesus said to him, %r@“%R@S%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@d%r@i%r@f%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@?%r@ %R@N%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@p%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@.%r@” %u@3Sitting across from temple on the Mount of Olives alone with Peter, James, John, and Andrew, %u@4they asked him confidentially, “When will these things take place, and what will be the sign indicating when the conclusion of all things is supposed to happen?” %u@5Jesus began by saying to them, %r@“%R@S%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@-%r@b%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@;%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@a%r@i%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@-%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@’%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@-%r@b%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@t%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@t%r@h%r@n%r@i%r@c%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@p%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@t%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@t%r@h%r@n%r@i%r@c%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@p%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@s%r@;%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@q%r@u%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@;%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@b%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@F%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@;%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@a%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@c%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@c%r@i%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@y%r@n%r@a%r@g%r@o%r@g%r@u%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@u%r@l%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@f%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %R@N%r@e%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@c%r@l%r@a%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@t%r@h%r@n%r@i%r@c%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@p%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@;%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@”%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@o%r@u%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %R@C%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@%nn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@”%R@L%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@a%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@g%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@”%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@—%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@e%r@q%r@u%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@f%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@r%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@v%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@p%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@n%r@s%r@e%r@t%r@…%r@w%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@d%r@d%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@…%r@w%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@…%r@w%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@M%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@d%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@ %R@S%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@c%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@!%r@”%r@%vn~
%sb~
Mark Chapter 14%hb~
          %u@1Now in two days the Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread was scheduled to start. The chief priests and the designated teachers were looking and looking for a way to use some sort of trickery to get ahold of him and kill him. %u@2In this regard, they kept on saying, “Not in the midst of the festival, lest the people riot.”%vn~
          %u@3While staying in Bethany, in Simon the leper’s house, while he was sitting at the dinner table, a woman with a jar of fragrant ointment—the pure, genuine expensive stuff—went up to him, cracked the jar open, and poured it all out on his head. %u@4Now some of them who were there were furious, complaining amongst themselves, “What does her wasting of this ointment accomplish? %u@5The fact is, this ointment here could’ve been sold for upwards of $30,000, and the proceeds donated to the poor.” They were fuming with indignation over her. %u@6But Jesus said, %r@“%R@L%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@—%r@w%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@?%r@ %R@S%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@v%r@o%r@r%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@S%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@m%r@b%r@a%r@l%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@r%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@m%r@m%r@i%r@f%r@i%r@c%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@M%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@:%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %R@N%r@e%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@c%r@l%r@a%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@—%r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@—%r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@s%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@m%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@0Judas Iscariot, one of the Twelve, left to meet up with the chief priests, in order for him to deliver Jesus into their custody. %u@1%u@1When they heard the proposal, they were delighted and promised to give him a wad of cash. They began to look for an opportune moment to apprehend him.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2On the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the day when they slaughtered the Passover sacrifice, his disciples, querying him, say, “Where do you want us to venture out to, to make the arrangements for you to partake of the Passover meal?” %u@1%u@3He dispatched two of his disciples telling them, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@;%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@o%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@P%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@c%r@i%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@?%r@’%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@r%r@g%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@6The disciples departed and went into the city and found things to be just like he told them, and they made the Passover meal arrangements.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7When it got to be late in the day, he arrived with the Twelve. %u@1%u@8While they were dining and relaxing, Jesus said, %r@“%R@M%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@—%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@9They became deeply upset, and they went on and on, one after another, telling him, “It’s not me.” %u@2%u@0But he said, %r@“%R@I%r@t%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@T%r@w%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@—%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@a%r@j%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@f%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@r%r@e%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@a%r@l%r@;%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2While still eating, he took a loaf of bread, gave thanks, broke it, gave it to them, and said, %r@“%R@T%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@3He took a cup, gave thanks, gave it to them, %u@2%u@4and said, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@s%r@o%r@l%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@(%r@i%r@n%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@6After they sang some hymns, they left for the Mount of Olives.%vn~
          %u@2%u@7Jesus then says to them, %r@“%R@A%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@n%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@%vn~
%r@%si~
%r@“%R@I%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@r%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@%vp~
%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@c%r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@%vp~
%r@%si~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@”%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@—%r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@G%r@a%r@l%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@9Peter said to him, “Even if everyone else falls out, I won’t, uh-uh.” %u@3%u@0Jesus said to him, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@n%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@3%u@1All the more vehemently he kept on saying, “Even if I have to die with you, I won’t deny you—no way!” The others, one after another, were saying the same thing.%nn~
          %u@3%u@2They went to a place called Gethsemane, and he said to his disciples, %r@“%R@S%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@” %u@3%u@3He took along with him Peter, James, and John and started to become gripped with agony and consternation. %u@3%u@4He, in the midst of it, says, %r@“%R@M%r@y%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@-%r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@:%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@c%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@” %u@3%u@5He wandered out a bit and fell on the ground and began to pray and pray, praying if it’s possible that this hour pass him by. %u@3%u@6In the midst of that he was saying, %r@“%R@A%r@b%r@b%r@a%r@—%r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@—%r@b%r@y%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@:%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@7He went and found them sleeping and then says to Peter, %r@“%R@S%r@i%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@?%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@c%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@E%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@c%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@;%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@n%r@g%r@-%r@h%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@9Again, he went out and prayed the same prayer, %u@4%u@0and again he found them sleeping; they didn’t know what they would say in response to him since their eyelids were sagging. %u@4%u@1He came a third time and said to them, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@?%r@—%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@—%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@G%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@;%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@3Right away, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, showed up with a large party armed with swords and clubs sent from the chief priests, designated teachers, and councilmen. %u@4%u@4His betrayer had set up a signal ahead of time, saying, “Whomever I greet with a kiss, seize him, secure him, and take him away.” %u@4%u@5He went straight over to him and then says, “Teacher,” and kissed him cordially. %u@4%u@6They laid their hands on him and grabbed ahold of him. %u@4%u@7One of the men standing there with Jesus (and who was one of his associates, supporters, and defenders) unsheathed a sword, attacked the chief priest’s slave, and sliced off his ear. %u@4%u@8Jesus considered what had happened and said to the party, %r@“%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@u%r@b%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@c%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@u%r@g%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@D%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@x%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@a%r@b%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@?%r@ %R@A%r@n%r@y%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@” %u@5%u@0Everyone who was standing there with Jesus deserted him and began to flee. %u@5%u@1A certain young man (a teenager) tagged along behind him, clothed only in a linen garment around his private parts. They grabbed him, %u@5%u@2but he shed the garment they grabbed and ran away naked.%vn~
          %u@5%u@3They took Jesus away to the high priest, and all the chief priests, the councilmen, and the designated teachers gathered together there. %u@5%u@4Peter followed him from a distance, until he was within the courtyard of the chief priest’s domicile, and he took a seat alongside the attendants, warming himself up next to the fire used as the light source. %u@5%u@5Now the chief priests and all the councilmen were trying to find someone to testify under oath against Jesus in order to sentence him to death, but they weren’t having any success finding anyone. %u@5%u@6To that ends, many were saying phony things against him in court under oath, but the testimonies weren’t compelling. %u@5%u@7Some of the ones taking the witness stand and testifying against him were saying, %u@5%u@8”We personally heard him say, ‘I’ll tear down this man-made temple myself, and in three days I’ll build another one, one that’s not man-made’,” %u@5%u@9but this testimony wasn’t adequate enough to produce a guilty verdict either. %u@6%u@0The high priest stood up in front of everyone and, by means of inquiry, asked Jesus, “You don’t have anything to say in response to those who’ve testified against you?” %u@6%u@1He kept silent and wouldn’t say anything in response. Again, the high priest asked him, “Are you the Messiah, the Christ, the Blessed Son?”, %u@6%u@2and he said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@-%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@A%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@%vn~
%r@%si~
%r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@%vp~
%R@I%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@%vp~
%R@C%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@o%r@u%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@k%r@y%r@”%r@%vp~
%si~
          %u@6%u@3Then the high priest became unglued and in a rage starting breaking things, all the while saying, “What further testimony do we need? %u@6%u@4You all heard the blasphemy; what’s it looking like to you?” So everyone there sentenced him to death. %u@6%u@5Some of them began to go about spitting on him, blindfolding him, and striking him, saying to him, “Prophesy.” And then the attendants took him and slapped him around.%vn~
          %u@6%u@6Being outside in the courtyard, Peter was approached by one of the high priest’s servant girls. %u@6%u@7She saw Peter warming himself up, took a good hard look at him, and then says to him, “You too were with Jesus of Nazareth.” %u@6%u@8He denied it, saying, “I have no first-hand knowledge or understanding of what you’re saying,” and he left the courtyard to go out to the porch. A rooster crowed. %u@6%u@9While looking at him, the servant girl began talking to the bystanders again, “This guy’s one of them.” %u@7%u@0He denied it again. Again, a bit later, the bystanders were saying to Peter, “Seriously—you’re one of them, since you’re a Galilean.” %u@7%u@1He began to cuss repeatedly and to swear by oaths, “I don’t know this person, whomever it is that you’re talking about.” %u@7%u@2Immediately a rooster crowed a second time. Peter remembered the statement which Jesus made, that before a rooster crows twice, you will have denied me three times. It hit him like a ton of bricks, and he started crying.%vn~
%sb~
Mark Chapter 15%hb~
          %u@1Without delay, late in the night the chief priests, along with all the councilmen and the designated teachers, convened a meeting, bound Jesus, carried him away, and delivered him into Pilate’s custody. %u@2Pilate asked him, “You’re the king of the Jews?” He answered him, “Whatever you say.” %u@3The chief priests accused him of many things. %u@4Again, Pilate asked him, “You’re not going to say anything in response? Take a look at how many accusations they’ve leveled against you.” %u@5But to Pilate’s astonishment, Jesus didn’t have anything more to say.%vn~
          %u@6He had an ongoing tradition, done at each festival, of releasing one prisoner for them, whomever they’d ask for. %u@7There was one called Barabbas who had been imprisoned along with the revolutionaries, in particular those who had committed murder during the insurrection. %u@8The crowd came over and initiated making the request, in accordance with his usual practice. %u@9Pilate responded to them, “Do you want me to set the king of the Jews free?”, %u@1%u@0since he was aware that the chief priests had him arrested out of envy. %u@1%u@1Now, the chief priests had whipped the crowd into a frenzy, in order that their preference would be to release Barabbas.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2Again, Pilate responded to them,%vn~
      “So now, what do you want me to do with the one who’s called the King of the Jews?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@3Again, they shouted, “Crucify him!”%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Pilate said to them multiple times, “…Because he’s done what wrong?”%vn~
      But they shouted all the more, “Crucify him!”%vn~
          %u@1%u@5Intending to placate the crowd, Pilate set Barabbas free and handed over Jesus, after he had him flogged, to be crucified.%vn~
          %u@1%u@6The soldiers led him away to a courtyard inside the compound, the one used by the governor’s security guards, and called over the entire company of guards. %u@1%u@7They clothed him in a robe a nobleman would wear and placed on him a crown, a wreath woven from thorns. %u@1%u@8They began to go about greeting him, “Pleased to meet you King of the Jews.” %u@1%u@9They kept on hitting him on the head with a rod, spitting on him, and getting on their knees in an act of subservience to him. %u@2%u@0When they finished ridiculing him, they took the robe off and put his clothes back on him, and they led him away to be crucified.%vn~
          %u@2%u@1They pressed into service a random passerby, Simon of Cyrene (the one who’s the father of Alexander and Rufus), who happened to be coming in from working out in the fields, to carry his cross. %u@2%u@2They brought him up on top of the place called Golgotha, which translated means “Skull Place.” %u@2%u@3They kept on trying to give him spiced wine, but he wouldn’t take it. %u@2%u@4They crucified him and divvied up his clothing, rolling dice to see who was going to get to take it away. %vn~
          %u@2%u@5Now it was mid-morning when they performed the crucifixion on him. %u@2%u@6There was a sign stating the reason why he was crucified, and it read, “The king of the Jews.” %u@2%u@7They crucified two thugs with him, together as a group, one to the left of him and one to the right of him. %u@2%u@8 %u@2%u@9Those who passed by reviled him, nodding their heads left and right saying, “Ah! The one who’ll supposedly destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days— %u@3%u@0Save yourself: come down off that cross.” %u@3%u@1In the same way, the chief priests and the designated teachers, going back and forth with each other making fun of him, in the midst of that were saying, “He went and rescued others, but he cannot save himself. %u@3%u@2The Messiah, the Christ, the King of Israel: let him come down from the cross now, so that we would see and believe.” Even his fellow crucifixion-mates kept on taunting him.%vn~
          %u@3%u@3When it got to be noon, darkness appeared over the entire planet until late afternoon, %u@3%u@4and in the late afternoon, Jesus shouted in a loud voice, %r@“%R@E%r@l%r@o%r@i%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@l%r@o%r@i%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@m%r@a%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@b%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@i%r@?%r@”, which is translated, %r@“%R@M%r@y%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@3%u@5Some of the bystanders heard this and started saying, “Look, he’s calling on Elijah.” %u@3%u@6Someone ran and soaked a sponge in a mixture of water and vinegar that the soldiers commonly drank, put it on a rod, and proceeded to offer it to him to drink, saying, “Let’s see if Elijah comes and takes him down from off the cross,” %u@3%u@7but Jesus let out a great cry and passed away, %u@3%u@8and the temple curtain was torn in two from top to bottom. %u@3%u@9Seeing this, the army captain standing across from him said, “This man really was the embodiment of a son of God.” %u@4%u@0Now there were also women watching at a distance, among whom were Mary Magdalene, Mary mother of James the younger and of Joses, and Salome, %u@4%u@1those women who were ever his followers and were constantly attending to his needs when he was in Galilee, and many other women who accompanied him to Jerusalem.%vn~
          %u@4%u@2It had gotten to be late, and since it was a preparatory day (that is, a pre-feast day or pre-Sabbath preparatory day), %u@4%u@3Joseph of Arimathea, an influential councilman, who also was himself a true believer, got up the courage, entered Pilate’s compound, and went up to Pilate and asked for Jesus’s body. %u@4%u@4But Pilate wondered if he had in fact died already, and summoned the captain and asked him if it had been a while since he died. %u@4%u@5Getting up to speed with the captain, he presented the body to Joseph as a gift, %u@4%u@6and Joseph purchased a cloth sheet made of linen and used for wrapping, took him down, rolled him up in the sheet, put him in a tomb, one which had been hewn out of a rock formation, and rolled a stone over the tomb’s entrance. %u@4%u@7Now Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses were monitoring where he was being placed.%vn~
%sb~
Mark Chapter 16%hb~
          %u@1After sundown, just after the Sabbath restrictions came to a close, Mary Magdalene, Mary mother of James, and Salome bought fragrant spices in order to go and apply to his body, covering it all over. %u@2Very early on Sunday morning, when the sun had just risen, they went to the tomb. %u@3They were repeatedly saying amongst themselves, “Who’s going to roll the stone back away from the entrance of the tomb?”, %u@4and they all at once looked up and observed that the stone had been rolled away (it was simply enormous, you see). %u@5They came to the tomb and saw a man who looked to be in his late teens or early twenties sitting off to the right wearing a long white robe, and they were startled out of their wits. %u@6But he then tells them, “Don’t be startled. Jesus of Nazareth who had been crucified has been resurrected; he’s not here—take a look at the place where they put him. %u@7In any event, go your way and tell his disciples—and Peter—that he’s heading out before them to Galilee. They’ll see him there, just like he told them they would.” %u@8They exited the tomb and began to run away like mad, since they were in a state of shock and were shaking all over. They didn’t say anything to anyone, since they were still too terrified to do so.%vn~
          %u@9After he had been resurrected early Sunday morning, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, whom he had cast out seven demons out of. %u@1%u@0That lady went and told the news to those who had been mourning and weeping with her, %u@1%u@1and those who heard that he’s alive and that he had been seen by her refused to believe it.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2Now after these appearances, he appeared in a different form to two of them while they were going out to the countryside, %u@1%u@3and those very people went away and told everyone else—they didn’t believe those people either.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Now last of all he appeared to the Eleven while they were relaxing taking a meal, and he chewed them out for their refusal to believe and for their hardness of heart, because they didn’t believe those who had beheld him resurrected. %u@1%u@5He said to them, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@h%r@a%r@b%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %R@N%r@e%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@o%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@g%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@H%r@e%r@
