          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@”%r@’%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@H%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@e%r@m%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@u%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@’%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@8After saying these things, he proceeded to forge on ahead to Jerusalem. %u@2%u@9As it turned out, as he got close to Bethphage and Bethany to the hill named the Mount of Olives, he dispatched two of the disciples, %u@3%u@0telling them, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@r%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@.%r@ %R@U%r@p%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@t%r@.%r@ %R@U%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@?%r@’%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@’%r@” %u@3%u@2The ones who were sent found things the way he told them they’d be: %u@3%u@3While they were untying the colt, the owners said to them, “Why are you untying the colt?” %u@3%u@4They said, “The Lord needs to take possession of it.” %u@3%u@5They led it to Jesus, and they saddled their cloaks upon the colt and helped Jesus mount it. %u@3%u@6On the way, people started spreading their cloaks out on the road underneath him.%vn~
          %u@3%u@7By the time they’d made their way to the downward slope of the Mount of Olives, the entire multitude of disciples began rejoicing, that is, praising God in a loud voice about everything that was going on—the miracles they had seen— %u@3%u@8saying%vn~
%si~
He’s favored!%vp~
He’s coming!%vp~
The king!%vp~
At Jehovah’s behest%vp~
Peace in heaven%vp~
And glory to the max%vp~
%si~
%u@3%u@9From the crowd some of the Pharisees said to him, “Teacher, tell your disciples to cut it out.” %u@4%u@0He replied, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@c%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@.%r@”%nn~
          %u@4%u@1As he drew near, seeing the city, he wept for it, %u@4%u@2saying, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@—%r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@—%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@d%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@R%r@e%r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@e%r@m%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@e%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@m%r@p%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@c%r@i%r@r%r@c%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@a%r@t%r@—%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@—%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@p%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@g%r@n%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@f%r@r%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@e%r@c%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@.%r@” %u@4%u@5He proceeded to enter the temple and cast out the merchandisers, %u@4%u@6telling them, “%R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@’%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@;%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@‘%r@r%r@o%r@b%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@’%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@7Day by day he was teaching in the temple. The chief priests and the designated teachers—the leading men—kept on looking for a way to annihilate him, %u@4%u@8but they were having trouble finding how they could pull it off; the fact of the matter was that all the folk-people kept on listening to him, hanging on to every word he spoke.%vn~
%sb~
Luke Chapter 20%hb~
          %u@1On one of those days, while he happened to be teaching and proclaiming good news to the folk-people in the temple, the chief priests and designated teachers together with the head-council’s councilmen approached him, trying to intimidate him, %u@2saying, “By what authority do you do these things? In other words, who was it who gave you this authority?—Tell us.” %u@3He replied to them, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@s%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@n%r@:%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@J%r@o%r@h%r@n%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@p%r@t%r@i%r@s%r@m%r@…%r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@i%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@-%r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@?%r@” %u@5They reasoned together amongst themselves, saying, ‘If we were to say, “from heaven,” he’ll say, “why didn’t you believe in him?” %u@6But if we were to say “man-made,” all the folk will stone us to death; the fact is, they’re convinced that John is a prophet.’ %u@7They answered that they didn’t know where it came from. %u@8Jesus said to them, %r@“%R@N%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@9Now he began telling the folk this analogy: %r@“%R@A%r@ %r@c%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@r%r@m%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@j%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@r%r@m%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@c%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@i%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@r%r@m%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@y%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@I%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@d%r@d%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@o%r@.%r@ %R@D%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@o%r@n%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@y%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@I%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@d%r@d%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@d%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@?%r@—%R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@B%r@e%r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %R@S%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@ %R@S%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@S%r@e%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@r%r@m%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@t%r@u%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@:%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@f%r@a%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@,%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@ %R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@?%r@—%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@H%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@p%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@r%r@m%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@.%r@” Once they heard this, they said, “Heaven forbid!” %u@1%u@7He looked at them and said, %r@“%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@S%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@:%r@%vn~
%r@%si~
%r@“%R@A%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@j%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@:%r@%vp~
%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@%vp~
%r@%si~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@”%R@E%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@;%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@%nn~
          %u@1%u@9At that moment, the designated teachers and chief priests sought to lay their hands upon him, but they feared the folk, seeing that they knew that he targeted them when he spoke that analogy.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0On the lookout for an opportunity, they sent agents pretending to be honest, decent people, in order that they might trap him in something he said, so that he could be taken into custody by the chief priest and placed in the jurisdiction of the governor. %u@2%u@1They asked him, “Teacher, we know that you’re straight-up when you speak and teach and that you’re not prone to partiality—not even close—you teach the exact truth of God’s way.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2”Do we have to pay taxes to Caesar or don’t we?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@3Aware of their cunning, he said to them, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@”%R@S%r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@(%r@a%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@n%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@u%r@s%r@)%r@…%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@?%r@”%vn~
      They said, “Caesar.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@5He said to them, %r@“%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@-%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %R@C%r@a%r@e%r@s%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@C%r@a%r@e%r@s%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@-%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@6They weren’t capable enough to trap him in any of his statements in front of the folk, and being in awe of his answer, they kept silent.%vn~
          %u@2%u@7Some of the Sadducees (those who say there is no life after death) approached him and asked, %u@2%u@8”Teacher, Moses wrote in the Old Testament, ‘If a man who has brothers and who has a wife dies childless, his brother should take the woman as his own wife and with his brother’s wife sire and raise a bloodline descendent. %u@2%u@9Now there were seven brothers. The first got married and died childless. %u@3%u@0The second %u@3%u@1and the third also married her, etc., up to the seventh, who died without leaving a child. %u@3%u@2Last of all, the woman died. %u@3%u@3In the life-to-come, which of them will find himself married? The fact is, all seven had been married to her at one time.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@4Jesus said to them, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@—%r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@:%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@c%r@a%r@p%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@l%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@u%r@p%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@—%r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@;%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@l%r@-%r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@f%r@l%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@d%r@u%r@c%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@J%r@a%r@c%r@o%r@b%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %u@3%u@9Some of the designated teachers thought it over and replied, “Well-put, Teacher.” %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@“%R@H%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@C%r@h%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@a%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %R@D%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@?%r@”%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@B%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@P%r@s%r@a%r@l%r@m%r@s%r@ %R@D%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@%vn~
%r@%si~
%r@“%R@A%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@%vp~
%R@S%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@M%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@%vp~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@U%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@e%r@m%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@b%r@j%r@u%r@g%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@%vp~

%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@”%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %R@D%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@‘%R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@’%r@;%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@?%r@”%r@%nn~
          %u@4%u@5While all the folk were hearing this, he said to his disciples, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@”%R@B%r@e%r@w%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@g%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@b%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@e%r@t%r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@q%r@u%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@y%r@n%r@a%r@g%r@o%r@g%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@p%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@T%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@v%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@d%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@n%r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@-%r@w%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@q%r@u%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
%sb~
Luke Chapter 21%hb~
          %u@1He looked up and saw the rich laying their offerings on the offering plate %u@2and saw a widow there who was poor put in two dollars, %u@3and said, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@d%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@i%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@b%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@i%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@;%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@i%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@5While a few people were talking about the temple, the fact that with pledge-offerings it had been adorned in beautiful stones, he said, %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@”%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@f%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@p%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@7So they asked him, “So now, teacher, when will these things take place? And what will be the supernatural sign when these things are about to happen?” %u@8He said, %r@“%R@S%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@a%r@i%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@-%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@’%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@f%r@r%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@’%r@ %R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@f%r@l%r@i%r@c%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@u%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@f%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@:%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@N%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@m%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@1%u@0Then he kept on talking telling them, %r@“%R@N%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@b%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@z%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@t%r@h%r@n%r@i%r@c%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@t%r@h%r@n%r@i%r@c%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@p%r@l%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@o%r@r%r@m%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@q%r@u%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@&%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@g%r@u%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@r%r@r%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@r%r@r%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@g%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@k%r@y%r@.%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@”%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@u%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@c%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@y%r@n%r@a%r@g%r@o%r@g%r@u%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@j%r@a%r@i%r@l%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@C%r@i%r@r%r@c%r@u%r@m%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@u%r@n%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@f%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@f%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@e%r@;%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@r%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@c%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@s%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@t%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@f%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@l%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@—%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@B%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@o%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%r@”%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %R@J%r@e%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@r%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@l%r@e%r@v%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@.%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@”%R@P%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@d%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@l%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@p%r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@n%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@i%r@m%r@a%r@l%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@p%r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@e%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@l%r@a%r@x%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@B%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@a%r@r%r@i%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@i%r@r%r@c%r@u%r@m%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@7He was teaching in the temple during the day, but he was leaving the city and spending the night on the large hill called the Mount of Olives. %u@3%u@8And all the folk were getting up early each morning to listen to him in the temple.%vn~
%sb~
Luke Chapter 22%hb~
          %u@1Now the festival of unleavened bread known as the Passover was coming up. %u@2The chief priests and the designated teachers were looking for a way to eliminate him; the fact of the matter was that they were engrossed with a fear of the folk-people. %u@3Satan had entered Judas (called Judas Iscariot), included in the twelve, %u@4and he went out and discussed with the chief priests and the captains of the temple guard how he’d go about betraying Jesus and delivering him into their custody. %u@5They were thrilled, and they agreed on the amount of money to pay him. %u@6He heartily gave his spoken consent and began seeking an opportune moment when the crowd wasn’t around to betray him, to get him into their custody.%vn~
          %u@7Now the Day of Unleavened Bread arrived, the day during which the Passover sacrificial lamb had to be slaughtered. %u@8He sent for Peter and John to tell them, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@a%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@P%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@c%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@.%r@” %u@9So they said to him, “Where do you want to have the preparations made?” %u@1%u@0He told them, %r@“%R@P%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@:%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@j%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@ %R@F%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@p%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@r%r@u%r@n%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@h%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@P%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@c%r@i%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@?%r@”%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@r%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@:%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@c%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@1%u@3They went forth and found things just like he had told them it would be and made the Passover preparations.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4When the hour for the meal came around, he sat down at the table, he and the missionaries together with him. %u@1%u@5He told them, %r@“%R@W%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %R@P%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@g%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@I%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@…%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@s%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@f%r@a%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@(%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@7Having taken a cup, he gave thanks and said, %r@“%R@T%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@r%r@i%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@I%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@y%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@i%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@(%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@9And having taken a loaf of bread, he gave thanks, ceremoniously broke it, and gave it to them, saying, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@f%r@.%r@ %R@D%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@f%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@m%r@b%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@0And he took the cup in like manner as the bread served at dinner, saying, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@a%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@—%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@—%r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@S%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@e%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@a%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@;%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@3They, for their part, started discussing amongst themselves who then among them could be the one who intended to perpetrate this.%vn~
          %u@2%u@4There happened to also be a friendly dispute among them, namely the question of which of them he considers to be the greatest. %u@2%u@5He said, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@u%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@(%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@)%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@l%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@t%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@—%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@n%r@i%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@u%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@?%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@c%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@”%R@S%r@i%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %R@S%r@i%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@:%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@f%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@;%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@g%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@g%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@r%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@” %u@3%u@3He said to him, “Lord, as far as I’m concerned, I’m prepared to go with you to prison and to my death.” %u@3%u@4But he said, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %R@P%r@e%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@n%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@5And he said to them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@l%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@?%r@”%r@ They said, “No.” %u@3%u@6He said, %r@“%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@;%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@.%r@ %R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@j%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@H%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@S%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@p%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@:%r@ %r@‘%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@i%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@i%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@s%r@.%r@’%r@ %R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@d%r@-%r@g%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@k%r@o%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@3%u@8But they said, “Lord, take a look, there’s two swords right here.” He said, %r@“%R@J%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@,%r@ %R@O%r@k%r@?%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@9According to habit, he departed and went to the Mount of Olives. His disciples followed him there also. %u@4%u@0After arriving at that spot, he said to them, %r@“%R@P%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@c%r@c%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@4%u@1He, though, withdrew about a stone’s-throw away from them, planted his knees, and proceeded to pray, %u@4%u@2saying, %r@“%R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@r%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@3Now an angel was seen strengthening him. %u@4%u@4And while he was in prayer pushing himself more and more to the limit in the suspense of the impending ordeal, his sweat happened to drip on the ground like when drops of blood from a cut drip on the ground. %u@4%u@5He got up from the prayer and went towards the disciples and found them sleeping from the pain, grief, and sorrow. %u@4%u@6He said to them, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@?%r@ %R@G%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@c%r@c%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@7While he was in the middle of talking, just like that a crowd appeared, and the one named Judas—one of the Twelve—was out in front of them and got close to Jesus to kiss him. %u@4%u@8Jesus said, %r@“%R@J%r@u%r@d%r@a%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@?%r@” %u@4%u@9Seeing what was about to happen, those surrounding him said, “Let’s strike with a sword, shall we Lord?”— %u@5%u@0And one of them struck the high priest’s servant and severed his right ear. %u@5%u@1In response Jesus said, %r@“%R@E%r@n%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@—%r@l%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@‘%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@”%r@ and he touched his ear and healed him. %u@5%u@2Jesus said to those who appeared by him, chief priests, temple guard, and councilmen, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@u%r@b%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@m%r@p%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@u%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@D%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@D%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@5%u@4They arrested him, led him away, and brought him into the high priest’s domicile; Peter followed at a distance. %u@5%u@5A fire had been lit in the middle of the courtyard and seats were gathered around it; Peter proceeded to sit among them. %u@5%u@6Some teenage servant girl saw him sitting in the light, stared at him, and said,%vn~
      “This guys was with him too.”%vn~
          %u@5%u@7He denied it saying, “I don’t know him, lady.”%vn~
          %u@5%u@8A little while later, another person saw him and said, “You’re one of them too.”%vn~
      But Peter said, “No I’m not, mister.”%vn~
          %u@5%u@9About an hour later someone else insisted, saying, “Seriously—this guy was with him too; fact is, he’s also a Galilean.”%vn~
          %u@6%u@0Peter said, “Mister, I don’t know what you’re talking about.”%vn~
      Immediately, while he was still in the middle of saying this, a rooster crowed. %u@6%u@1The Lord turned and looked at Peter, and Peter recalled the Lord’s statement just like he spoke it to him, %r@“%R@B%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@r%r@o%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@d%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@6%u@2He left and went outside and wept bitterly.%vn~
          %u@6%u@3The men who were holding him began to make fun of him; while beating him %u@6%u@4blindfolded, they asked him, “Prophesy—who hit you?” %u@6%u@5And they went on and on insulting him.%vn~
          %u@6%u@6And as dawn came, the councilmen, and in addition the high priests and designated teachers, were convened in their council known as the Sanhedrin, %u@6%u@7saying, “Tell us if you’re the Messiah, the Christ.”%r@ He said, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@p%r@l%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@F%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@s%r@u%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@f%r@u%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@e%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@e%r@c%r@u%r@t%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@7%u@0They all said, “Well then, are you the Son of God?”, so he said to them, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@.%r@” %u@7%u@1They said, “Why do we need to find any more witnesses? As you can see, we heard it ourselves out of his own mouth.”%vn~
%sb~
Luke Chapter 23%hb~
          %u@1The entire group of them got up and brought him to Pilate. %u@2They proceeded to make accusations against him, saying, “We found this guy corrupting our culture, preventing people from paying Caesar taxes, and saying that he himself is a Messiah-king.” %u@3So Pilate asked him, “Are you the king of Jews?”, but he answered, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@.%r@” %u@4Pilate said to the chief priests and to the throng, “I haven’t found anything to charge this man with,” %u@5but they kept on saying more and more strenuously and assertively, “He incites the folk-people by teaching and instructing them throughout the whole district of Judea. He started this in Galilee and worked his way from there all the way down to here.”%vn~
          %u@6After Pilate heard this, he asked if the man was a Galilean. %u@7Once he realized that he falls under Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him over to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem during these festival days. %u@8Seeing Jesus, Herod was especially delighted, since for quite a long time he’d been dying to see him owing to hearing about him time and time again, and with glee was hoping to see him cause some supernatural sign or miracle to happen. %u@9In a good deal of remarks and statements, he asked him several things, but he wouldn’t reply. %u@1%u@0The chief priests and the designated teachers were standing there vehemently accusing him. %u@1%u@1Herod and his soldiers together treated him with contempt, mocked him by dressing him in bright, colorful, beautiful clothing, and sent him back to Pilate. %u@1%u@2That very day a friendship formed between Herod and Pilate; hitherto they had been hostile towards each other.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3Now Pilate summoned the chief priests, leaders, and the folk-people. %u@1%u@4He said to them, “You brought me this man who supposedly subverts the folk, and—as you can see—I personally examined him in front of you all and found nothing to charge him with, %u@1%u@5and—no—neither did Herod, seeing that he sent him back to us. And—as you can see—nothing worthy of death has been committed by him. %u@1%u@6So now, I’ll teach him a lesson by flogging him and then I’ll set him free.” %u@1%u@7%vn~
          %u@1%u@8They shouted back in unison, “Get rid of this guy and let Barabbas go for us.” %u@1%u@9(This was the very person who was thrown in prison for murderer because of some insurrection which occurred in the city.)%vn~
          %u@2%u@0Again, Pilate addressed them, “Are you wanting to let Jesus go?”,%vn~
          %u@2%u@1but they kept on shouting telling him, “Crucify him and crucify him some more!”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2The third time he said to them, “Why? What has this guy done wrong? I’ve found nothing to charge him with which warrants the death penalty. I’ll teach him a lesson by flogging him and then I’ll set him free.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@3But they kept on piling on in loud voices demanding that he be crucified, and their shouts were overwhelming; %u@2%u@4Pilate decided to acquiesce to their request. %u@2%u@5He freed the one thrown in prison due to an insurrection, the one they kept asking for, but he delivered Jesus over to their will and desire.%vn~
          %u@2%u@6As they were leading him away, they pressed into service one Simon of Cyrene, who was coming home from work, and put the cross on him to carry behind Jesus. %u@2%u@7A large crowd of the folk people followed him, and women who continuously thumped their chests and wept and wailed and sang dirges. %u@2%u@8Jesus turned to them and said, %r@“%R@D%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@d%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@D%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@—%r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@—%r@d%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@B%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@g%r@n%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@r%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@f%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@…%r@%vn~
%r@%si~
%r@”%r@…%R@S%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@%vp~
%r@‘%R@F%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@’%r@%vp~
%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@s%r@,%r@%vp~
%r@‘%R@H%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@’%r@.%r@%vp~
%r@%si~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@”%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@l%r@y%r@-%r@c%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@u%r@m%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@-%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@?%r@”%r@%nn~
          %u@3%u@2Now he and two other criminals along with him were being led in a spectacle of a procession to be hoisted up on crosses and crucified. %u@3%u@3When they came to the place called The Skull, there he and the criminals were crucified, one to the right and the other to the left. %u@3%u@4Jesus proceeded to say, %r@“%R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@” To divide his clothing up amongst themselves, they rolled dice. %u@3%u@5The folk-people stood around watching. The rulers also began ridiculing him, saying, “He rescued others; if this guy is God’s Messiah, His Christ—the Chosen One, let him rescue himself.” %u@3%u@6The soldiers also made fun of him by going up to him, bringing him spoiled-wine vinegar, %u@3%u@7and saying, “If you’re the king of the Jews, rescue yourself.” %u@3%u@8There was also a sign on top of him: “This guy is the king of the Jews.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@9One of the criminals hung on a cross with him kept on insulting him saying, “Aren’t you the Messiah, the Christ? Rescue yourself and us as well.” %u@4%u@0But the other responded, scolding him, “Don’t you fear God even one bit because you’re facing the same sentence? %u@4%u@1Sure, we’re being treated justly; indeed we deserve what’s been meted out to us. But this guy did nothing egregious.” %u@4%u@2He said, “Jesus, remember me when you assume your preordained position in your kingdom.” %u@4%u@3And he said to him, “Mark my words, you’ll be with me in Paradise today.”%vn~
          %u@4%u@4Around the time it reached noon, darkness appeared over the entire land and persisted until three in the afternoon, %u@4%u@5while the sun was obscured. The temple curtain was torn in two down the middle. %u@4%u@6Calling out in a loud voice, Jesus said, %r@“%R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@.%r@” %u@4%u@7Upon seeing what had happened, the centurion glorified God saying, “This man really was righteous.” %u@4%u@8And everyone in the crowd of bystanders, having witnessed what had happened, thumped their chests and began to leave. %u@4%u@9Everyone who knew him was standing at a distance to view these things, including the women from Galilee who too accompanied him as his followers.%vn~
          %u@5%u@0As events unfolded a man named Joseph, he being a councilman, and a good and righteous man %u@5%u@1(this fellow was not in agreement with the council and did not consent with what they did), from Arimathea, a city in Judea, one who was embracing God’s invitation for Him to be involved in his life (was receiving God’s kingdom)— %u@5%u@2This fellow approached Pilate and asked for Jesus’s body. %u@5%u@3He pulled him down, wrapped him in fine linen, and put him in a tomb hewn from rock, in which nobody had yet been laid to rest.%vn~
          %u@5%u@4It was a preparation day, preparation for the Sabbath which would start the following day, and the sun was about to set and consequently begin the next day, the Sabbath. %u@5%u@5The women, those who had come down with him from Galilee, trailed behind following those who buried him, saw the tomb and how his body was placed, %u@5%u@6and returned and prepared fragrance and ointment.%vn~
      And while, yes, they were inactive on the Sabbath according to the commandment not to work on the Sabbath…%vn~
%sb~
Luke Chapter 24%hb~
          %u@1…Nevertheless, they got up early on Sunday, the first day of the week, while it was still quite dark, and went to the tomb bringing the fragrance they had prepared. %u@2They found that the stone had been rolled away from the tomb, %u@3but after entering didn’t find the Lord Jesus’s body. %u@4While the women were in a state of perplexity over this, out of nowhere two men in gleaming clothing unexpectedly and abruptly showed up standing right next to them, %u@5and they became terrified of them. Turning their faces to the ground, they said to them, “Why are you looking for the Living One among the dead? %u@6He’s not here; he’s been resurrected instead. Remember how he spoke to you while you were still in Galilee, %u@7saying that the Man must be betrayed and taken into custody by the hands of sinners, crucified, and resurrected on the third day.”%vn~
          %u@8They remembered his remarks, %u@9returned from the tomb, and announced all these things to the eleven and to everyone else. %u@1%u@0Now Mary Magdalene, Joanna, and James’s mother Mary were there at the tomb. The other women who were associated with them proceeded to tell these things to the missionaries. %u@1%u@1The impression that they took away from their presentation was that their remarks were just a lot of gibberish, and they refused to believe them. %u@1%u@2But Peter got up and ran to the tomb, stooped and sees nothing but the linens only, and left from there wondering to himself what had happened.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3As events unfolded, on that very same day two of them were walking into a town, they being about seven miles/eleven kilometers from Jerusalem, in a town named Emmaus. %u@1%u@4They were conversing with one another about how all of these things had transpired. %u@1%u@5It came to pass while they were conversing, making points and counterpoints, that Jesus himself approached them and walked together with them. %u@1%u@6But their eyes were being held shut from recognizing him. %u@1%u@7He said to them,%vn~
      %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
      They stood still and looked depressed. %u@1%u@8The one named Cleopas replied, “Are you the only one in Jerusalem who’s totally clueless%u@ and doesn’t know what’s happened these last few days?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@9He said, %r@“%R@L%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@?%r@”%vn~
      They said, “Those things concerning Jesus of Nazareth, a man who became a mighty prophet in deed and in speech as considered by God and by all the folk-people; %u@2%u@0furthermore, how our chief priests and rulers arrested him with the goal of sentencing him to death, and they crucified him. %u@2%u@1We kept on hoping that he’s the one who’s going to do what it takes to liberate Israel; meanwhile, three days have gone by since these things happened and that hasn’t been the case. %u@2%u@2But on top of that, some of the women who hang around us but had gone on an excursion caused us to lose our minds: they were terrified when they were at the tomb %u@2%u@3and didn’t find his body there, and after returning they said that they even saw angels who appeared to them in visible form and the angels say that he’s alive. %u@2%u@4And certain members of our group left for the tomb and found things to be this way, just like the women told us, but didn’t see him.” %u@2%u@5And he said to them, %r@“%R@O%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@D%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@a%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@C%r@h%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@7And having begun from the beginning of the Old Testament and walking through it, he proceeded to interpret for them all those references in the Scriptures about him.%vn~
          %u@2%u@8They got near to the town which they were going to, and he acted as if he was going to continue walking further. %u@2%u@9They urged him, “Stay with us, since evening’s approaching and the day’s already come to a close.” He entered the house they arrived at as though he was going to stay with them. %u@3%u@0As a matter of course, while he was relaxed at the dinner table, he took the bread, gave thanks, broke it, and gave it to them. %u@3%u@1Their eyes were opened, and they recognized him, but he left and didn’t come back. %u@3%u@2They said to each other, “Weren’t our hearts burning within us as he was speaking to us on the way here, as he kept on unfolding the meaning of the Scriptures?” %u@3%u@3And they got up that very moment and returned to Jerusalem and found the eleven gathered together, they and those associated with them, %u@3%u@4saying that the Lord really had come back from the dead and was seen by Simon. %u@3%u@5They explained what happened on the road and how he came to be recognized by them in the breaking of bread.%vn~
          %u@3%u@6While they were still speaking these words, he stood among them and then says to them, “Peace be with you.” %u@3%u@7They were startled and became frightened and thought they were looking at a ghost. %u@3%u@8He said, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@r%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@c%r@l%r@u%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@a%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@c%r@o%r@l%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@T%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@e%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@o%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@g%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@4%u@0After he said this, he showed them his hands and feet. %u@4%u@1Out of the joy, wonder, and marvel of it all, they just couldn’t believe it, so he said to them, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@4%u@2They gave him a piece of broiled fish, %u@4%u@3and he took it and ate it right in front of them.%vn~
          %u@4%u@4He said to them, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@o%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@4%u@5Then he opened their minds for them to understand the Scriptures. %u@4%u@6He said, %r@“%r@…%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@u%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@a%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@C%r@h%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@p%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@u%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@
