%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@c%r@l%r@a%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@d%r@u%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@i%r@t%r@i%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@J%r@e%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@:%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@f%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@—%r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@—%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@;%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@5%u@0He took them all the way out to Bethany and lifted up his hands and blessed them. %u@5%u@1It so happened while he was blessing them that he parted from them and was carried up into the sky, into heaven. %u@5%u@2They worshipped him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy, %u@5%u@3and were in the temple blessing God throughout it all.%vn~

The Gospel of John%ha~
       John’s Gospel stands apart from the other three—Matthew, Mark, and Luke, the Synoptic Gospels—in more ways than one. It’s content is different, it’s chronology is different. The Greek that John uses is very simple and is, for the most part, readily translated word-for-word into English. However, underneath the simplistic wording is an enigmatic book which makes vague, abstract generalizations it does not explain. John’s epistles are even more simplistic yet enigmatic and vague.%nv~
       On the one hand, John’s writing needs a good copy editing. Among other things, he uses the wrong verb tenses, is too ambiguous, assuming that the reader will have no problem filling in the missing content. Had I submitted something comparable to the way that John writes as a high school term paper, my English teachers would’ve marked it all up in red.%nv~
       On the other hand, John has his own peculiar meaning of words and phrases that differ from everything else in the NT and which can only be learned by studying his writings, the simple, vague phrases which are enigmatic and profound. In fact, from a language perspective, John’s Gospel should be viewed in a separate light from the remainder of the NT, so different is his writing. Inside this simple fisherman was a deeply spiritual man, one who was Semitic and not Western, one who used words and grammatical constructs his own ways and not the way everyone else does.%nv~
       Of all the books in the NT, John’s Gospel has enjoyed preeminence from the days of the early church. This is proven by the fact that the oldest surviving manuscripts NT manuscripts, and the most numerous of the oldest, are of John. And if Matthew was written to Jews, Mark to Romans, Luke to Greeks, then John was written to Christians.%nv~
%sb~
John Chapter 1%hb~
          %u@1In the beginning was the Concept, and the Concept was with God, and the Concept was God, having His very nature. %u@2This person was in the beginning with God. %u@3Through him all things came into being, and nothing which has come into being came into being apart from him. %u@4In him was life, and the Life was the light of mankind. %u@5And in the midst of it all the Light shined in the Darkness, and the Darkness couldn’t take it down, overpower it, or contain it.%vn~
          %u@6A man sent from God appeared on the scene, and his name was John. %u@7This fellow came to give an official account, so that he would give an account concerning the Light, so that all would believe through him. %u@8That fellow was not the Light—instead, he came in order that he would testify about the Light: %u@9It was the True Light, that which shines to all mankind, while coming into the world, the established order of humans. %u@1%u@0He was in and among the world and the world came into being through him, but the world didn’t know him. %u@1%u@1He went to his own particular group of people, and his own didn’t whole-heartedly welcome and embrace him. %u@1%u@2But to whomever whole-heartedly welcomed and embraced him, it was to them he gave the authorization and power to become children of God, to those who believe and have faith in his established authority, %u@1%u@3to those who were begotten neither out of spillings of blood nor out of a best-effort of self nor out of carnal desire nor out of the will of a man, but instead were begotten from God.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4And the Concept became flesh and set up camp among us. We beheld his glory, glory as that of an only-begotten issued from the Father, full of grace and truth. %u@1%u@5John testified about him, having cried out, “This fellow here is the one I referred to when I said, ‘The one who comes after me has been the center of my attention, because he was (and is) superior to me.’”%vn~
          %u@1%u@6When you get to the bottom of it all, all of us have received of his fullness, and grace piled on top of grace. %u@1%u@7When you get to the bottom of it all, the Old Testament Law was given through Moses; the grace and the truth which we’re talking about came into being through Jesus Christ. %u@1%u@8Nobody has seen God fully; God’s only-begotten, who’s in tight with the Father—that’s the person who brought him out of obscurity.”%vn~
        %u@1%u@9John’s testimony%vn~
      When the Judean Jews sent priests and clergymen from Jerusalem to him in order to ask, “Who are you?”, %u@2%u@0he gave them a straight-up answer saying forthrightly, “Me?—No, I’m not the Messiah.” %u@2%u@1They asked him, %vn~
      “Just who are you? Are you Elijah?”%vn~
      Jumping right in, he said, “No, I’m not.”%vn~
      “Are you the Prophet?”%vn~
      He answered, “No.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2So they said to him, “Who are you then?—Tell us so we can give a reply to those who sent us. Who do you claim to be?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@3He said, “I’m a…%vn~
%si~
“…Voice shouting out in the countryside%vp~
Barricade the road the Lord will take!%vp~
%si~
“…as written by the Prophet Isaiah.”%nn~
          %u@2%u@4Now the ones who had been sent were sent by the Pharisees. %u@2%u@5They posed a question asking, “So now, why do you perform baptisms if you’re neither the Messiah, Elijah, nor the Prophet?” %u@2%u@6John replied by saying, “My role is to baptize in water. But someone has taken a stand in your midst, someone whom you have no first-hand knowledge of, %u@2%u@7someone who follows in my footsteps, someone whom I’m not even worthy of unfastening his sandal strap.” %u@2%u@8These things took place in Bethany alongside the Jordan River, the place where John was baptizing.%vn~
          %u@2%u@9The next day he saw Jesus coming towards him and said, “Look here—God’s lamb who takes away the world’s sin. %u@3%u@0This is the person whom I referred to when I said, ‘A man’s coming who’ll follow in my footsteps, a man who has become the center of my attention because he is superior to me because he was in existence before I was.’ %u@3%u@1I had no personal first-hand knowledge of him; on the contrary, he was not known even to me in order he would become known to Israel all at once. This is the reason my role was to come baptizing in water.” %u@3%u@2And John solemnly declared in a statement for the record that he had beheld the Spirit coming down out of the sky like a dove and remaining upon him from then on: %u@3%u@3”I had no personal first-hand knowledge of him; on the contrary, the One who sent me to baptize in water, He’s the One who said to me, ‘Upon whom you happen to behold the Spirit coming down and remaining upon, that’s the person who baptizes in the Holy Spirit.’ %u@3%u@4And I have beheld this event personally and have solemnly attested that this person is the Son of God.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@5Again, the next day John was just standing there, he and two of his disciples, %u@3%u@6and saw Jesus going here and there, and interjected, “Look here—God’s lamb.” %u@3%u@7His two disciples heard him speaking and followed Jesus, in order to become his disciples. %u@3%u@8Jesus turned and saw them following him and, prompting them, said, “What can I do for you?” So they said to him, “Rabbi (which is translated ‘Teacher’), where are you staying?” %u@3%u@9Keeping their curiosity, he said, “Come and see.” So they went and saw where he was staying and remained in his company that day; it was late afternoon around four. %u@4%u@0One of the two who used to be John’s disciples who heard and became his, Jesus’s, disciple was Simon Peter’s brother Andrew. %u@4%u@1First thing he did was to find his brother Simon and tell him, “I’ve found the Messiah” (which translated means ‘Christ’). %u@4%u@2He led him to Jesus. Jesus saw him and said, “%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@i%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@J%r@o%r@h%r@n%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@‘%R@C%r@e%r@p%r@h%r@a%r@s%r@’%r@”%r@ (which translated means ‘Peter’).%vn~
          %u@4%u@3He wanted to depart for Galilee the next day, and he winds up finding Phillip. Jumping right in, Jesus said to him, “Be my follower.” %u@4%u@4Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the same city that Andrew and Peter were from. %u@4%u@5Philip tracked down Nathanael and, figuring he’d get a reply, said to him,%vn~
      “We found the person spoken of in the writings of the Old Testament, Jesus of Nazareth son of Joseph.”%vn~
          %u@4%u@6Nathanael said, “Can anything good come out of Nazareth?”%vn~
      Philip said to him, “Come take a look.”%vn~
          %u@4%u@7Jesus saw Nathanael coming towards him and said about him, %r@“%R@C%r@h%r@e%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@—%r@a%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@n%r@u%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@s%r@r%r@a%r@e%r@l%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@u%r@p%r@l%r@i%r@c%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@ %vn~
          %u@4%u@8Nathanael, starting a conversation, said to him, “Where do you know me from?”%vn~
      Jesus replied, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@P%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@p%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@w%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4%u@9Nathanael replied, “Teacher, you’re the Son of God, you’re king over Israel.” %vn~
          %u@5%u@0Jesus formulated a reply, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@w%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@?%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@5%u@1He continued, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@:%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@k%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@.”%vn~
%sb~
John Chapter 2%hb~
          %u@1A wedding occurred on a Tuesday in Cana, Galilee, and Jesus’s mother was attending. %u@2Jesus was also invited—and so were his disciples—to the wedding. %u@3Having run out of wine, Jesus’s mother, in the heat of the moment, said to him,%vn~
      “They don’t have any wine.”%vn~
          %u@4Jesus, consumed with the comment, said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@—%r@m%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@!”%vn~
          %u@5As things were unfolding, his mother said to the waiters, “Do whatever he tells you to do.”%vn~
          %u@6Now according to the Jewish purification restrictions, there were six large clay pots lying nearby, with a capacity of up to a keg or a keg and a half apiece. %u@7Jesus, on top of the situation, told them, %r@“%R@F%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%r@ They filled the pots all the way up with water. %u@8Continuing his train of thought, he told them, %r@“%R@N%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@a%r@w%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@î%r@t%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@‘%r@d%r@.%r@” So they brought some over to him. %u@9As the maître ‘d tasted the water-which-had-become-wine, not knowing where it came from (the waiters who had drawn the water knew), the maître ‘d called for the groom %u@1%u@0and, going over procedures, told him, “Every person sets out the good wine first and when everyone eventually becomes tipsy sets out the lower-grade stuff. You, though, have withheld the good wine until now.” %u@1%u@1This miracle that Jesus performed in Cana, Galilee was the first in a long series of miracles signalling that he’s from God, and it evinced his glory and made believers out of his disciples.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2After this he went down to Capernaum, he, his mother, his brothers, and his disciples, and stayed there for many days.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3The Jewish Passover was coming up, and Jesus went down to Jerusalem. %u@1%u@4In the temple he ran across those selling cattle, sheep, and doves, and the money changers seated at tables, %u@1%u@5and he made a whip out of a cord and drove them all out of the temple, including the sheep and the cattle. He swept the money changers’ coins off the tables spilling them all over the floor and overturned the tables. %u@1%u@6He told the dove sellers, %r@“%R@G%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@—%r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@u%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@r%r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@t%r@!%r@”%r@ %u@1%u@7His disciples remembered a verse of Scripture that says, “The zeal for Your house utterly consumes me.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@8The Judean Jews, putting two plus two together, responded, “What spectacular miracle will you demonstrate for us, seeing that you do these things?” %u@1%u@9Jesus answered, %r@“%R@B%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@2%u@0Thereupon the Judeans said, “It took forty-six years to build this temple, and you’ll erect it in three days?” %u@2%u@1But that ol’ boy was by obsession talking about the temple of his body. %u@2%u@2So now, when he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered what he was saying in that moment of obsession, and they believed the verse of Scripture and the remark which Jesus spoke to them.%vn~
          %u@2%u@3As he was in the temple in Jerusalem during the Passover, many believed that he had authority bequeathed on him, seeing the miracles that he did. %u@2%u@4Jesus, however, wasn’t inclined to trust them on account of him having an understanding of everything and everyone. %u@2%u@5He didn’t need anyone to spell out plainly and clearly the aspects of human nature; the fact is, he was ever mindful of and was forever discerning human nature.%vn~
%sb~
John Chapter 3%hb~
          %u@1Now there was a man named Nicodemus who was one of the Pharisees and was a Jewish ruler. %u@2This fellow went to Jesus one night and said,%vn~
      “Rabbi, we know that you’re a teacher sent from God; the fact of the matter is, no one can perform the spectacular miracles which you perform, unless God be with him.”%vn~
          %u@3Jesus, getting to the heart of it all, replied, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@:%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@v%r@o%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@(%r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@4On the heels of that, Nicodemus said, “How can a person who’s not a baby be born? It’s not possible for him to enter his mother’s womb a second time and be born.”%vn~
          %u@5Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@:%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@,%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@(%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@d%r@o%r@m%r@)%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@(%r@i%r@.%r@e%r@.%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@h%r@y%r@s%r@i%r@c%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@p%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@i%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@;%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@)%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@(%r@i%r@.%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@h%r@y%r@s%r@i%r@c%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@;%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@e%r@f%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@s%r@;%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@)%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@i%r@r%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@s%r@.%r@’%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@—%r@n%r@o%r@—%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@9Nicodemus answered, “How can this happen?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@0Jesus answered, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@r%r@u%r@c%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@s%r@r%r@a%r@e%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@i%r@l%r@t%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@q%r@u%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@-%r@b%r@e%r@g%r@o%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@i%r@l%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@i%r@l%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@;%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@i%r@l%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@I%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@b%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@u%r@g%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@2After these things happened, Jesus and his disciples went to Judea and started to spend time there, and he was baptizing and baptizing. %u@2%u@3Now John was also baptizing in Aenon which is near Salim, since there was a lot of water there which could be used for baptizing. People from everywhere kept on showing up flocking to him, and one after another was being baptized, %u@2%u@4as, you see, John hadn’t been thrown into jail yet. %vn~
          %u@2%u@5Now then, an argument broke out between John’s disciples and some Judeans concerning ritualistic purification, %u@2%u@6and they approached John and said, “Teacher, the one who was with you on the other side of the Jordan, to whom you went on record as saying, ‘Take a look here—this fellow’s doing baptisms and everyone’s migrating towards him…’” %u@2%u@7John replied, “A person can’t whole-heartedly take to heart, accept, and embrace a single thing if it hadn’t been granted to him from heaven. %u@2%u@8It was your own selves who declared to me that I am not the Messiah, but rather I’m one sent as a missionary to be a precursor to that fellow. %u@2%u@9A groom takes possession of the bride when he takes her into the newlyweds’ suite to consummate the marriage. The best-man, the one who’s posted outside the suite listening for him to tell him that they’re ready to exit the suite and start the wedding party, is overwhelmed with joy upon hearing the groom’s voice. So now, this is the same joy which has been fulfilled in me. %u@3%u@0That fellow must grow in popularity, while I taper off in popularity.%vn~
          %u@3%u@1”The one from the higher spiritual plane above who’s going forth is over all. The one who exists out of the lower spiritual plane of the earth is from the earth and speaks as you’d expect as one from the earth. The one who comes from heaven is over all. %u@3%u@2What he beheld and heard—this is what he’s giving an official account of, and hardly anybody at all whole-heartedly embraces and acts on his account. %u@3%u@3The one who whole-heartedly embraced his account put his stamp of approval on the fact that God is true to His word. %u@3%u@4You see, the one God sent speaks God’s sentences; indeed, He does not limit the quantity of the Spirit which He gives. %u@3%u@5The Father loves the son, and all things have been placed under his direct control. %u@3%u@6The one who believes in the son has that special fullness of life, eternal life. He who’s unconvinced and therefore disobedient, not believing in the son, won’t experience that special fullness of life; instead, the wrath of God hovers over him.”%vn~
%sb~
John Chapter 4%hb~
          %u@1So now, as Jesus became aware that the Pharisees heard that he’s making more disciples and doing more baptisms than John— %u@2and yet it wasn’t Jesus himself who was doing the baptisms, but it was his disciples instead— %u@3he abandoned Judea and departed once more for Galilee, %u@4and in doing so had to go through Samaria. %u@5So he came to a Samaritan city called Sychar in the vicinity of where Jacob gave land to his son Joseph. %u@6Now one of Jacob’s wells was there, so Jesus, worn out from the trip, simply proceeded to sit down at the well. It was around noon.%vn~
          %u@7A Samaritan woman came to draw water. Striking up a conversation, Jesus said to her, “Give me a drink of water,” %u@8seeing that his disciples had gone into the city to buy food. %u@9Engaging in the conversation, the Samaritan woman said,%vn~
      “How is it that you being a Jew ask me, a Samaritan woman, for a drink of water?” (You see, the Jews don’t have anything to do with the Samaritans.)%vn~
          %u@1%u@0Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@f%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@G%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@,%r@’%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@k%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@1The woman, engaged in the conversation, said, “Sir, you don’t have any bucket and the well is deep. So where did you get this so-called Living Water from? %u@1%u@2You’re not greater than our ancestor Jacob, who gave us the well and personally drank from it on an ongoing basis (and so did his sons and his livestock), are you?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@3Jesus answered, %r@“%R@E%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@5The woman, drawn into the dialogue, said, “Sir, give me this water, so that I’ll never get thirsty again or have to come over here to draw water.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@6He, following right along with everything spoken, said, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@—%r@c%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@s%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@7The woman answered, “I don’t have a husband.”%vn~
      Jesus, continuing on, told her, %r@“%R@W%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@-%r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@s%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@s%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@y%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@s%r@b%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@W%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@e%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@9The woman, still engaged, said, “Sir, I can tell that you’re a prophet. %u@2%u@0Our ancestors held their worship services on this mountain but you all say that Jerusalem is the place where worship services must be held.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@1Jesus, still continuing, told her, %r@“%R@T%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@t%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %R@J%r@e%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@a%r@l%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@;%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@g%r@r%r@a%r@m%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@J%r@e%r@w%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@—%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@—%r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@:%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@r%r@i%r@b%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@F%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@:%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@5The woman, whose interest hadn’t subsided, said, “I know that the Messiah, the one called ‘Christ,’ is coming. When that person finally does come, he’ll give us a rundown about everything and anything.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@6He continued and said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@-%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@-%R@O%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@-%R@O%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@7Just then, his disciples came back, and they were amazed that he was in the middle of speaking to a woman. But yet, nobody said, “What are you up to?”, or, “Why are you talking to her?” %u@2%u@8So the woman left her bucket of water behind and departed for the city. She said to the people there, %u@2%u@9”Come see a man who told me everything I did wrong in life, in a nutshell. He couldn’t be the Messiah, could he?” %u@3%u@0They left the city and started towards him.%vn~
          %u@3%u@1Meanwhile, the disciples asked him time and again, “Teacher, eat something.” %u@3%u@2But he said, “I have food to eat which you have no knowledge of.” %u@3%u@3The disciples started repeating to one another, “Nobody brought him anything to eat, did they?” %u@3%u@4Jesus, engaging with them, said, %r@“%R@M%r@y%r@ %r@‘%r@f%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@t%r@e%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@I%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@-%r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@h%r@s%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@’%r@?%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@y%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@u%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@l%r@-%r@v%r@i%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@—%r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@e%r@l%r@d%r@s%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@w%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@w%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@e%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@j%r@o%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@I%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@p%r@s%r@’%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@I%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@p%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@;%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@j%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@i%r@p%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@b%r@o%r@r%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@9Many from that Samaritan city believed in him through the woman’s account claiming “he told me everything I ever did.” %u@4%u@0So as the Samaritans approached him, they kept asking him to stay with them, and he remained there for two days. %u@4%u@1Many more believed on account of his message; %u@4%u@2furthermore, they kept on telling the woman, “It’s no longer the case that we believe simply as a result of your non-stop talking. You see, we have heard and know for a fact that this fellow truly is the savior of the world, the established order of the human race.”%vn~
          %u@4%u@3From there, he departed after two days for Galilee; %u@4%u@4the fact is, Jesus frankly stated that a prophet gets no respect in his hometown and among his relatives. %u@4%u@5So when he arrived in Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him whole-heartedly, everyone having seen what he did at the Passover festival in Jerusalem; for they too had gone to the festival.%vn~
          %u@4%u@6So he once more went to Cana, Galilee, where he had turned the water into wine. There was a court official in Capernaum who had a malady of some sort. %u@4%u@7This fellow heard that Jesus had come from Judea to Galilee and went out to visit him and to ask that he would come over and heal his son, seeing that he was going to die. %u@4%u@8Jesus said to him, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@a%r@c%r@u%r@l%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@4%u@9Distressed, the official said, “Sir, come over before my boy dies.” %u@5%u@0Fully aware, Jesus said, %r@“%R@G%r@o%r@—%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@”%r@ The man believed the statement which Jesus spoke to him and proceeded to go. %u@5%u@1Now his servants had already come by to meet him saying that his boy is alive, %u@5%u@2so he inquired of them what time it was when he got better. They said that the fever broke yesterday at one o’clock in the afternoon. %u@5%u@3The father knew that that was the time which Jesus told him, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@”%r@ and he believed for himself, he and his entire household too. %u@5%u@4This was yet a second spectacular miracle which Jesus did, having left Judea for Galilee.%vn~
%sb~
John Chapter 5%hb~
          %u@1After these things occurred, there was a Jewish holiday festival, and Jesus went down to Jerusalem. %u@2Among the citizens of Jerusalem, there was a pool at the Sheep Gate (which in Aramaic is called Bethesda), which has five porticos. %u@3In these porticos lay a multitude of those who are feeble with sicknesses of one sort or another, of the blind, the lame, and those with shriveled-up limbs, perpetually lying there. %u@4 %u@5Now there was a man with a sickness who had been there for thirty-eight years, and his sickness made him feeble. %u@6Seeing this fellow lying there, Jesus, knowing that he had been there for a long time, engaged him in conversation and said, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@7The sick man answered, “Sir, I have no person to toss me into the pool when the water’s been agitated. While it’s agitated and I’m on my way to the pool, someone else cuts in front of me.” %u@8Jesus got to the point and said, %r@“%R@G%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@” %u@9and the man got better immediately, picked his cot up, and walked around.%vn~
      But that was on a Sabbath. %u@1%u@0So now, the Judean Jews proceeded to say to the man who had been healed,%vn~
      “It’s the Sabbath, and you’re not allowed to pick up your cot and take it somewhere.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@1He replied, “The guy who made me well told me, %r@‘%R@P%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@’.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@2They asked, “Who’s the person who told you, ‘Pick it up and walk around’?” %u@1%u@3But the man who was healed didn’t know who it was; you see, Jesus had ducked out of sight and into the crowd. %u@1%u@4After all of this, Jesus found him in the temple and said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@.%r@ %R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@5The man left from there and reported to the Judeans that Jesus was the one who made him better. %u@1%u@6Because of this, the Judeans began to go after Jesus, because he did this on the Sabbath. %u@1%u@7Jesus’s reply to them was, %r@“%R@U%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %R@I%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@1%u@8So because of this, the Judeans were all the more trying to kill him, because he wasn’t just going about freeing people from their sicknesses on the Sabbath, but he also kept saying that God is his own Father, making himself out to be equal to God.%vn~
          %u@1%u@9So Jesus proceeded to defend himself, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@c%r@e%r@p%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@ %R@F%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@s%r@h%r@i%r@p%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@—%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@—%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@z%r@z%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@S%r@o%r@—%r@n%r@o%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@i%r@l%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@c%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@c%r@c%r@u%r@p%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@o%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@o%r@t%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
%sb~
John Chapter 6%hb~
          %u@1After these events, Jesus departed for the other side of the Sea of Galilee (otherwise known as Tiberias). %u@2A large crowd followed him, because they were seeing miracle after miracle that he did for those feeble with a sickness of one sort or another. %u@3Jesus hiked up a large hill and proceeded to sit down there with his disciples. %u@4Now the Passover wasn’t too far off, the Jewish religious holiday festival. %u@5So Jesus, after lifting up his eyes and seeing that a large crowd was approaching, engaged Philip, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@?%r@”%r@ %u@6Now he was saying this to test him; the fact is, he knew what he was about to do. %u@7Philip replied, “$20,000 worth of bread wouldn’t suffice for each person to get even just a bit.” %u@8One of the disciples, Andrew Simon Peter’s brother, jumped in and said, %u@9“There’s a lad here who has five loaves of barley-bread and two grilled fishes. Apart from these, what’s available for such a crowd as this?” %u@1%u@0Jesus, adding to this, said, %r@“%R@G%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@o%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@l%r@a%r@x%r@.%r@”%vn~
      Now there was a lot of grass in the area, so around five-thousand grown men—not to mention the women and children—found a place to sit. %u@1%u@1Thereupon, Jesus took the break, offered thanks, and distributed it to those seated, and the same with the fish, as much as they kept wanting. %u@1%u@2As they were filled, he further said to his disciples, %r@“%R@G%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@f%r@t%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@c%r@r%r@a%r@p%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@1%u@3So they gathered and filled twelve baskets of scraps from what was leftover by those who had eaten, leftovers from out of the five loaves of the barley-bread. %u@1%u@4The people, upon seeing the miracle that he did, began saying, “This fellow really is the Prophet who comes to the world.” %u@1%u@5So Jesus, knowing that they intended to come and seize him and carry him off to make him king, withdrew alone into the large hill.%vn~
          %u@1%u@6As it had gotten late, his disciples went down to the lake, %u@1%u@7boarded a boat, and began making their way to the other side of the lake, to Capernaum. Darkness had already fallen, and Jesus hadn’t joined them yet; %u@1%u@8furthermore, strong gusts of wind began to stir over the lake. %u@1%u@9Having reached the point where they had rowed around 3 or 3.5 miles (4.5 or 5.5 km), they saw Jesus walking about on top of the lake, and he was getting near the boat. They became frightened. %u@2%u@0He engages with them, %r@“%R@I%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@f%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@1Then they kept on wanting to take him into the boat, but in no time the boat landed on the shore that they were destined for.%vn~
          %u@2%u@2The next day, the crowd which stood on the other side of the lake observed that at the time they departed there weren’t any other boats there except for the one, and since Jesus hadn’t joined his disciples in the boat, the disciples had departed alone instead. %u@2%u@3That aside, other small boats from Tiberias arrived near the place where the Lord gave thanks and they ate the bread, %u@2%u@4so when the crowd saw that Jesus wasn’t there nor were his disciples, they boarded these boats and went to Capernaum looking for Jesus.%vn~
          %u@2%u@5When they found him on the other side of the lake, they said to him, “Teacher, when did you get here?” %u@2%u@6Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@:%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@i%r@p%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@n%r@-%r@p%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@—%R@G%r@o%r@d%r@—%r@d%r@e%r@c%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@u%r@a%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@r%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@8So they said, “How shall we go about doing the things of God?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@9Jesus replied, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@:%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@0So they said, “So now, what miraculous sign do you perform, in order that we would see it and believe in you? What can you do? %u@3%u@1Our ancestors ate bread called manna while in the wilderness, just as it’s recorded in Scripture, ‘He gave them bread from the sky—from heaven—to eat’.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@2Jesus said, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@:%r@ %R@M%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@;%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@T%r@r%r@u%r@e%r@ %R@B%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@3%u@4So they said, “Sir, give us this bread from now on.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@5Jesus said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@B%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@L%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@—%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@—%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@u%r@n%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@E%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@s%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@f%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@j%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@           %u@4%u@1Then the Judeans started arguing about him, because he said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@B%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@.%r@” %u@4%u@2They were stuck on, “Isn’t this just Jesus, Joseph’s son? Don’t we know about the father and the mother? How can he just now say, ‘I have come down out of heaven’?” %u@4%u@3Jesus responded, %r@“%R@N%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@g%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@           %u@5%u@2So the Judeans proceeded to squabble with one another, “How can this guy give us his flesh to eat?” %u@5%u@3Jesus said, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@
