%R@L%r@i%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@k%r@y%r@—%r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@” %u@5%u@9He said these things in a synagogue in Capernaum, teaching there.%vn~
          %u@6%u@0So then, many of his disciples who listened said, “This is a tough concept. Who can listen to it and take heed of it?” %u@6%u@1Jesus, aware within himself that his disciples were grumbling about this, told them, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@W%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@f%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@o%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@;%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@—%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@e%r@f%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@—%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@l%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@o%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@u%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@” You see, Jesus knew from the outset that some of them wouldn’t believe, and knew who it is who would betray him. %u@6%u@5He continued, %r@“%R@B%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@o%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@c%r@e%r@p%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@6%u@6As a result, many of his disciples left to head back to where they came from originally and weren’t travelling about with him anymore. %u@6%u@7Jesus then said to the Twelve, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@o%r@?%r@” %u@6%u@8Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, what things shall we leave you for and go to? You have messages of that special fullness of life, eternal life; %u@6%u@9and we—we have believed and have come to recognize that you are the Holy One of God.” %u@7%u@0Jesus replied to them, %r@“%R@H%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@l%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@T%r@w%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@-%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@b%r@b%r@e%r@r%r@?%r@” %u@7%u@1He was side-railed in talking about Judas Son of Simon Iscariot. Indeed, this guy—one of the Twelve—was intending to betray him, thinking it over and over.%vn~
%sb~
John Chapter 7%hb~
          %u@1After all of this, Jesus was travelling about Galilee; indeed, he hadn’t been wanting to travel throughout Judea, since the Judeans wouldn’t let up in trying to kill him. %u@2The Jewish Festival of Tabernacles was coming up, %u@3so his brothers said to him, “Relocate from here and make your way to Judea, so that your disciples too might behold the miraculous works that you do. %u@4When you get right down to it, no one does something in seclusion when he’s striving to be a well-known, public figure. If you do these miraculous works, reveal yourself to the world.” %u@5The fact is, his brothers hadn’t been believing in him all the while either. %u@6So Jesus, consuming the remark, told them, %r@“%R@M%r@y%r@ %R@T%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %R@T%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@—%r@i%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@i%r@l%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@v%r@a%r@l%r@;%r@ %R@M%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@—%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@i%r@v%r@a%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@f%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@” %u@9Having said these things, he stayed in Galilee.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0As his brothers went down to the festival, then he too went, not openly but secretly instead. %u@1%u@1So then, the Judeans kept searching for him at the festival and kept on repeating, “Where is that guy?” %u@1%u@2There was a huge amount of murmuring and grumbling about him by the crowds; some kept saying that he’s good, but others kept saying, “No—on the contrary—he leads the crowd astray.” %u@1%u@3No one, however, was talking about him in public due to the fear of the Judeans.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Now already midway through the festival, Jesus went over to the temple and proceeded to teach. %u@1%u@5The Judeans were amazed, “How does this fellow know the Scriptures so well, being uneducated?” %u@1%u@6Jesus replied, %r@“%R@M%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@i%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@;%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@u%r@p%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@H%r@a%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %R@M%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@u%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %R@L%r@a%r@w%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@?%r@ %R@W%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@?%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@0The crowd answered, “You’re demon-possessed. Who’s trying to kill you?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@1Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@u%r@l%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@o%r@b%r@e%r@y%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@b%r@b%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@A%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@a%r@w%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@M%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@c%r@i%r@r%r@c%r@u%r@m%r@c%r@i%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@(%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@i%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@a%r@w%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@M%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@i%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@t%r@r%r@i%r@a%r@r%r@c%r@h%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@o%r@l%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@)%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@i%r@r%r@c%r@u%r@m%r@c%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@b%r@b%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@i%r@r%r@c%r@u%r@m%r@c%r@i%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@b%r@b%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@p%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@a%r@w%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@M%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@g%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@a%r@b%r@b%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@R%r@e%r@f%r@r%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@r%r@f%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@;%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@2%u@5Some of those from Jerusalem then proceeded to say, “Isn’t this the guy they’re trying to kill? %u@2%u@6Take a look—he’s speaking aloud in public, and they’re not saying a thing to him. %u@2%u@7That aside—we know what this guy’s all about; but when the Messiah, the Christ, does in fact come, no one’s been able to figure out what his raison d’être will be.” %u@2%u@8So while Jesus was teaching in the temple, he cried out, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@.%r@ %R@A%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@e%r@,%r@ %R@W%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@I%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@3%u@0So they tried to apprehend him, but no one managed to lay a hand on him, because his time hadn’t come yet. %u@3%u@1But among those in the crowd, many believed in him. They kept saying, “When the Messiah does come, will he perform more miracles than what this fellow’s done?”%vn~
          %u@3%u@2The Pharisees heard that the crowd was chatting about these matters, matters which are related to him, so the High Priests and the Pharisees sent temple police to apprehend him. %u@3%u@3Jesus then said, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@o%r@k%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@.%r@” %u@3%u@5So the Judeans said to themselves, “Where’s this guy planning to go that we won’t be able to find him? He’s not intending to go to the Jews scattered throughout the Roman Empire and teach the Greek-speaking Jews, is he? %u@3%u@6What about this statement, ‘You’ll look for me and won’t be able to find me,’ and, ‘Where I’ll be, you can’t go’?”%vn~
          %u@3%u@7On the last day of the festival, Jesus stood and cried out, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@k%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@‘%R@S%r@t%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@m%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@’%r@.%r@”%r@ %u@3%u@9Now he was talking about the Spirit, he whom they were going to receive, that is, those who believed in him. You see, the Spirit had not yet come, since Jesus had not yet been glorified.%vn~
          %u@4%u@0Then out of the crowd these words arose and were spoken, “This person really is the Prophet promised in the Old Testament.” %u@4%u@1Others were saying, “This person is the Messiah.” But others were saying, “Certainly the Messiah won’t come from Galilee, will he? %u@4%u@2Isn’t there a verse in the Old Testament which says that the Messiah will be a descendant of David and will be from Bethlehem, the town where David was from?” %u@4%u@3So the crowd split into factions over him, %u@4%u@4and some of them kept wanting to apprehend him; instead, no one laid a hand on him.%vn~
          %u@4%u@5The police returned to the High Priests and the Pharisees, who told those guys, “Why didn’t you haul him off?” %u@4%u@6The police replied, “Never before has a man spoken the way this man has.” %u@4%u@7The Pharisees replied, “You haven’t been led astray too, have you? %u@4%u@8Not a single one of the rulers or the Pharisees have believed in him, have they? %u@4%u@9Instead, the only ones who’ve believed in him is this bunch, the ones who don’t understand the Law of Moses—the accursed.” %u@5%u@0Nicodemus, the one who visited him earlier on and who’s one of them, interjected and said to them, %u@5%u@1”Our code of law, the Law of Moses, doesn’t allow a verdict to be rendered unless the defendant is first heard from and what he did is known, now does it?” %u@5%u@2They replied, “You’re not a Galilean-sympathizer too, are you? Check into it and—you’ll see—no prophet from Galilee gets brought to prominence.” %u@5%u@3%vn~
%sb~
John Chapter 8%hb~
          %u@1%u@–%u@1%u@1%vn~
          %u@1%u@2He talked to them again. %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@s%r@o%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@;%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@.%r@”%vn~
          %u@1%u@3The Pharisees then said, “You’re stating claims about yourself; your claims aren’t true.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@4Jesus formulated a reply, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@a%r@i%r@m%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@a%r@i%r@m%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@.%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@w%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@Y%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@o%r@t%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@,%r@           %u@1%u@9So they proceeded to say to him, “Where is your father?”%vn~
      Jesus replied, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@0He made these remarks while teaching in the temple treasury. No one apprehended him, since his moment hadn’t come yet.%vn~
          %u@2%u@1He spoke to them once more. %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@‘%r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@’?” %u@2%u@3He proceeded to tell them, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@5Then they proceeded to say, “Who are you?” Jesus said, %r@“%R@D%r@o%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@” %u@2%u@7They didn’t understand that he was speaking to them about the Father. %u@2%u@8So then Jesus said, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@           %u@3%u@1Then Jesus proceeded to say to the Judeans who just believed in him, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %R@M%r@y%r@ %R@M%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@c%r@i%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@3They replied, “We’re descendants of Abraham and haven’t ever been enslaved; how can you say ‘the truth will set you free’?”%vn~
          %u@3%u@4Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@y%r@p%r@i%r@c%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@l%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@h%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@;%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@S%r@o%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@I%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@A%r@b%r@r%r@a%r@h%r@a%r@m%r@;%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@—%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@           %u@3%u@9They retorted, “Our father—our ancestor—is Abraham.”%vn~
      Jesus then says, %r@“%R@H%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@A%r@b%r@r%r@a%r@h%r@a%r@m%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@s%r@p%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %R@A%r@b%r@r%r@a%r@h%r@a%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@o%r@k%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@A%r@b%r@r%r@a%r@h%r@a%r@m%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
      So they said, “We were not born out of wedlock, the result of two people who just slept together. We have one father: God.”%vn~
          %u@4%u@2Jesus said, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@S%r@p%r@e%r@e%r@c%r@h%r@?%r@ %R@B%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %R@M%r@y%r@ %R@M%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@A%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@v%r@i%r@l%r@—%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@s%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@u%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@f%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@p%r@p%r@o%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@ %R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@t%r@y%r@p%r@i%r@c%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@P%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@a%r@g%r@a%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@L%r@i%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@I%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@—%r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@W%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@?%r@ %R@I%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@y%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@:%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@4%u@8The Judeans took this in and responded, “Didn’t we just nail it when we said you’re a Samaritan and you’re demon-possessed?” %u@4%u@9Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@-%r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@;%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@r%r@y%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@o%r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@;%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@d%r@g%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@:%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@s%r@ %R@M%r@y%r@ %R@M%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@—%r@n%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@5%u@2The Judeans said, “Now we know for sure that you’re demon-possessed. Abraham died and so did the Old Testament prophets, but you say, ‘If someone keeps My Message, there’s no way that he’ll stare at death from now to the end of time—no way’.” %u@5%u@3You’re not greater than our ancestor, our father Abraham, who was someone who died, are you? The prophets all died too. What do you fashion yourself to be?”%vn~
          %u@5%u@4Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@f%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@,%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@ %R@M%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@f%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@ %R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@j%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@-%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@a%r@r%r@;%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@o%r@r%r@ %R@A%r@b%r@r%r@a%r@h%r@a%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@y%r@ %R@D%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@j%r@o%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@5%u@7The Judeans said back to him, “You’re not even fifty years old yet, and you’ve seen Abraham?”%vn~
          %u@5%u@8Jesus said, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@:%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@f%r@o%r@r%r@e%r@ %R@A%r@b%r@r%r@a%r@h%r@a%r@m%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@x%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@-%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@l%r@y%r@-%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@.%r@” %u@5%u@9They then picked up stones to stone him with, but Jesus ducked out of sight and left the temple.%vn~
%sb~
John Chapter 9%hb~
          %u@1While passing through, he saw a man who had been blind from birth. %u@2His disciples asked, “Teacher, who sinned, this fellow or his parents, in order for him to have become blind?” %u@3Jesus replied, %r@“%R@N%r@e%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%R@W%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@u%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@l%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@u%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@.%r@ %R@N%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@b%r@o%r@d%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@.%r@” %u@6Having said this, he spat on the ground and formed a wad of mud out of the saliva and rubbed the mud on the blind man’s eyes, %u@7and told him, “%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@i%r@l%r@o%r@a%r@m%r@ %r@(%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@s%r@l%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@‘%R@S%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@’%r@)%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@o%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@” So he left and washed himself off in the pool and went his way able to see.%vn~
          %u@8Then the neighbors and those who used to stare at him because he was a beggar began to say,%vn~
      “Isn’t this guy the one who sits and begs?”%vn~
          %u@9Others began to say, “Ya, that’s the guy.”%vn~
      Others began to say, “No, no, he just looks like him.”%vn~
      That fellow proceeded to say, “Uh-uh, it’s me.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@0They proceeded to say, “How did you gain your sight?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@1That fellow replied, “The man called Jesus made some mud and rubbed it on my eyes and told me, %r@‘%R@G%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@i%r@l%r@o%r@a%r@m%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@o%r@l%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@.%r@’%r@ So I left, washed myself, and gained my sight.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@2They said, “Where is that fellow?”%vn~
      He then says, “I don’t know.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@3They then take him (the person who used to be blind) to the Pharisees. %u@1%u@4Now the day of the week that Jesus made the mud and gave him his sight was Saturday—the Sabbath. %u@1%u@5So the Pharisees asked him once again,%vn~
      “How did you gain your sight?”%vn~
      He told them, “He put mud on my eyes, I washed myself off, and now I can see.” %vn~
          %u@1%u@6Then some of the Pharisees proceeded to say, “This guy—this…this person—is not from God, since he doesn’t keep the Sabbath.”%vn~
      But others proceeded to say, “How can a person who’s a sinner perform such miracles?” And they split into factions over him. %vn~
          %u@1%u@7So they then say to the blind man, “What do you have to say about him, since he gave you your sight?” He said, “He’s a prophet.” %u@1%u@8So now, the Judeans didn’t believe what was being claimed concerning him, that he was blind and gained his sight, until they called for the parents of the man who gained his sight. %u@1%u@9They questioned them,%vn~
      “Is this fellow your son, whom you’re saying was born blind? So how is it that he can see now?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@0His parents comeback was, “We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind, %u@2%u@1but we don’t know how it is that he can see now, nor do we know who gave him his sight. Ask him, he’s an adult. He can speak for himself now.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2His parents said these things because they were consumed with the fear of the Judeans. The fact of the matter is that the Pharisees had already decided that if anyone should profess that he is the Messiah, the Christ, he’ll be excommunicated. %u@2%u@3This is the reason his parents said, “He’s an adult, ask him.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@4They then called for the man, the one who was blind, a second time and said to him, “Come clean on this and tell us the truth. We know that this man is a sinner.” %vn~
          %u@2%u@5So that fellow answered, “I have no idea if he’s a sinner. But what I do know is that I was blind and now I can see.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@6So they said, “What did he do to you? How did he grant you your sight?” %vn~
          %u@2%u@7He replied, “I told you already and you didn’t listen. Why do you want to hear it all over again? Surely you too don’t want to become his disciples, now do you?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@8Then they gave him a tongue-lashing, “You’re that guy’s disciple?—We’re disciples of Moses. %u@2%u@9We know that God has spoken to Moses and that this is recorded in the Old Testament Law of Moses, but we don’t know if this guy needs to get his head straightened out.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@0The man retorted, “What’s so amazing about this is that you don’t know if he’s a wacko or not, but he granted me the ability to see. %u@3%u@1We know that God doesn’t pay any regard to sinners; on the other hand, if someone is devout and does His will, he’ll give him regard. %u@3%u@2From the beginning of time, no one’s ever heard that someone granted sight to a person who’d been born blind. %u@3%u@3If this fellow isn’t from God, he wouldn’t have been able to go about doing any miracles.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@4They took this in and told him, “You were born entirely into various sins, and you have the audacity to instruct us?” And they shunned him from religious society.%vn~
          %u@3%u@5Jesus heard that he’d been shunned, hunted him down, and said, “%R@D%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@6That fellow replied, “And who would that be, sir, so that I may believe in him?”%vn~
          %u@3%u@7Jesus said, %r@“%R@B%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@8He said, “I believe, sir!”, and prostrated himself before him.%vn~
          %u@3%u@9Jesus said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@t%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@4%u@0Some of the Pharisees who were with him heard these things and said to him, “We’re not blind too, are we?”%vn~
          %u@4%u@1Jesus told them, %r@“%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@r%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
%sb~
John Chapter 10%hb~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@”%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@:%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@b%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@n%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@c%r@l%r@i%r@m%r@b%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@           %u@7So Jesus spoke again, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@;%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@—%R@I%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@i%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@c%r@e%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@1%u@9Yet again, the Judeans split into factions on account of this message. %u@2%u@0The majority said over and over, “He’s demon-possessed and stark-raving mad. Why does anyone listen to him?” %u@2%u@1Others said over and over, “These aren’t the words of a demon-possessed man. Can anyone who’s demon possessed give sight to the blind?”%vn~
          %u@2%u@2That was the time of year that Hanukkah occurred in Jerusalem, it being late December. %u@2%u@3Jesus was in the temple, in the Portico of Solomon, walking around. %u@2%u@4The Judeans surrounded him and proceeded to say, “How much longer are you going to leave us in the dark? We’re dying to know—if you’re the Messiah, tell us straight up and openly.” %u@2%u@5Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@i%r@d%r@e%r@—%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@w%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@M%r@y%r@ %R@S%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@M%r@y%r@ %R@S%r@h%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@v%r@o%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@I%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@e%r@c%r@i%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@f%r@u%r@l%r@l%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@(%r@e%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@a%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@)%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@n%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@i%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@u%r@i%r@n%r@—%r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@c%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@M%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@y%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@1Once again, the Judeans hauled stones over in order to stone him. %u@3%u@2Jesus responded to them, %r@“%R@I%r@’%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@i%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@w%r@e%r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@W%r@h%r@i%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@?%r@” %u@3%u@3The Judeans replied, “We’re not stoning you for a work that is awesome, but for blasphemy, and because you being a human being make yourself out to be God.” %u@3%u@4Jesus replied, %r@“%R@I%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@T%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@d%r@s%r@’%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%R@A%r@s%r@s%r@u%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@o%r@p%r@l%r@e%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@W%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@—%r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@y%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@(%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@B%r@i%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@d%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@)%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@i%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@‘%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@b%r@l%r@a%r@s%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@e%r@r%r@’%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@ %r@‘%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@?%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@N%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@q%r@u%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@i%r@n%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@”%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@ %u@3%u@9Thereupon they proceeded to try to seize him, but he escaped from their clutches.%vn~
          %u@4%u@0He departed once more to beyond the Jordan, to the place where John was originally baptizing, and he stayed there a while. %u@4%u@1Many came to him, and they kept saying, “Sure, John never performed a miracle, but everything John said about him is true.” %u@4%u@2And many there believed in him.%vn~
%sb~
John Chapter 11%hb~
          %u@1There was a certain person who was laid out with an illness, Lazarus of Bethany, which is the same town that Mary and her sister Martha were from. %u@2Now it was Mary who poured oil over the Lord and wiped his feet with her hair, and it was her brother Lazarus who was ill, %u@3so the sisters sent him a message to tell him, “Attn: Lord, your good friend is ill.” %u@4Upon hearing this, Jesus said, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@l%r@l%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@f%r@e%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@l%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@f%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@.%r@” %u@5Now Jesus loved Martha, her sister, and Lazarus, %u@6so when he heard that he was ill, he loitered in the area for two more days.%vn~
          %u@7Then, after this, he then says to the disciples, “%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@a%r@c%r@k%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %R@J%r@u%r@d%r@e%r@a%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@8The disciples tell him, “Teacher, at the moment the Judeans are trying to stone you to death, and you want to head on back again?”%vn~
          %u@9Jesus replied, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@w%r@e%r@l%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@?%r@ %R@I%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@u%r@r%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@m%r@p%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@b%r@j%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@l%r@l%r@u%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@n%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@m%r@p%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@a%r@u%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@l%r@l%r@u%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@1He said these things and he then tells them next, %r@“%R@O%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@i%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@L%r@a%r@z%r@a%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@;%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@s%r@p%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@1%u@2So the disciples said, %r@“%R@L%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@l%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@3Now Jesus had spoken about his death; those disciples, however, thought that he was talking about actual sleep. %u@1%u@4So then Jesus said to them plainly, %r@“%R@L%r@a%r@z%r@a%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@a%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@r%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@E%r@n%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@.%r@” %u@1%u@6So Thomas (called “Twin”) said to his fellow disciples, “Let’s go so we get to die with him too.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@7So Jesus went and found that he’d already been in the tomb for four days. %u@1%u@8Now Bethany was not too far from Jerusalem, just over 1¾ miles/2.7 km. %u@1%u@9Many Judeans had gone to Martha and Mary to console them over the loss of their brother. %u@2%u@0So Martha, as she heard that Jesus was coming, confronted him; Mary, meanwhile, was sitting in the house. %u@2%u@1So Martha said to Jesus,%vn~
      “Lord, had you been here, our brother wouldn’t have died. %u@2%u@2But even now I know that if you were to ask God for something, God would grant you your request.” %vn~
          %u@2%u@3Jesus then says, %r@“%R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@r%r@o%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@4Martha then says, “I know that he’ll come back to life in the Resurrection, i.e. the Great Regeneration Event, on the Day of Reckoning.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@5Jesus said, %r@“%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@—%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@a%r@n%r@ %R@W%R@O%R@N%r@’%R@T%r@—%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@e%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@n%r@i%r@t%r@y%r@.%r@ %R@D%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@2%u@7She then says, “Yes, Lord. I reached the point where I believe that you yourself are the Messiah, the Christ, the Son of God who comes into the world.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@8Having said this, she left and in private called for her sister Mary, “The Teacher is here now and is calling for you.” %u@2%u@9Right as that woman heard, she quickly got herself up and proceeded to go to him. %u@3%u@0Jesus hadn’t yet arrived in town, but instead was still at the place where Martha met him, %u@3%u@1so the Judeans who were with her in the house consoling her, seeing that Mary got up in a hurry and left, followed her, thinking she was headed out to the tomb in order to weep there. %u@3%u@2So Mary, as she went to where Jesus was, saw him, fell at his feet, telling him,%vn~
      “Lord, if you’d been here, my brother wouldn’t have died.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@3Thereupon Jesus, as he saw her crying, her and the Judeans who came with her, groaned deeply within his spirit and was deeply disturbed.%vn~
          %u@3%u@4He said, %r@“%R@W%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@p%r@l%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
      They then say, “Lord, come take a look.”%vn~
          %u@3%u@5Jesus wept.%vn~
          %u@3%u@6So the Judeans proceeded to say, “See how close of a friend he was?”%u@3%u@7Some of them said, “Could not this fellow, who granted sight to the blind, have done something to prevent him from dying?”%vn~
          %u@3%u@8So Jesus once more groaned deeply within himself and then arrives at the tomb. Now there was a cave there, and a stone lying at its entrance. %u@3%u@9Jesus then says, %vn~
      %r@“%R@R%r@e%r@m%r@o%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
      The sister of the deceased, Martha, then says, “Lord, he’ll be reeking by now; it’s been four days, you see.”%vn~
          %u@4%u@0Jesus then says, %r@“%R@D%r@i%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@G%r@o%r@d%r@?%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@4%u@1They removed the stone. Jesus lifted his eyes upwards and said, “Father, I thank you that You hear me this once. %u@4%u@2I have known that You always listen to me—that aside, on account of the crowd which is standing around I said, ‘In order they might believe that You sent me’.” %u@4%u@3Once he said these things, he cried out in a loud voice,%vn~
      %r@“%R@L%r@a%r@z%r@a%r@r%r@u%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@!%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@4%u@4He who had died exited the tomb, feet bound and hands wrapped, and his face wrapped in a handkerchief. Jesus then says, %r@“%R@L%r@o%r@o%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@4%u@5Many of the Judeans who went to Mary’s place and witnessed what he did believed in him. %u@4%u@6Some of them left, went to the Pharisees, and told them what Jesus had done. %u@4%u@7So the Pharisees and Chief Priests gathered together, convened a council, and proceeded to say, “What are we going to do, since this man performs so many miracles? %u@4%u@8If we let him keep doing this, everyone will eventually believe in him, and the Romans will take both the sacred place—the temple—and the nation of Israel as well away from us. %u@4%u@9A certain one of them, someone notable, Caiaphas, high priest for that year, told them, “You all don’t know a thing— %u@5%u@0you certainly haven’t figured out that it’s beneficial for everyone for one man to die on behalf of the people rather than for the entire nation to be destroyed.” %u@5%u@1Now he hadn’t said this by his own volition, but rather, being that year’s high priest, he prophesied that he was intending for Jesus to die on behalf of the nation, %u@5%u@2and not just for the nation alone but in order that the children of God, the scattered ones, also be gathered into one. %u@5%u@3So from that day on, they began to conspire in order to kill him.%vn~
          %u@5%u@4So Jesus no longer went about in public among the Judeans, but departed from there instead to an area in the middle of nowhere close to the sea, to a town called Ephraim, and remained there with his disciples.%vn~
          %u@5%u@5Now the Jewish Passover was coming up and many from the area went down to Jerusalem before the Passover in order to ceremoniously purify themselves. %u@5%u@6They kept searching for Jesus, and while standing around in the temple they kept saying to one another, “What do you think? Think he won’t come to the festival?” %u@5%u@7The chief priests and the Pharisees had issued an order that if anyone were to know or were to figure out where he might be, he was to report it, so that they could arrest him.%vn~
%sb~
John Chapter 12%hb~
          %u@1Six days before the Passover, Jesus went to Bethany, where Lazarus was, whom he, Jesus, raised from the dead, %u@2so they held a dinner for him there; Martha was doing the serving, but Lazarus was one of the ones relaxing at the table with him. %u@3Then Mary takes a can’s worth of fragrant ointment—the pure, genuine expensive stuff— poured it on his feet, and wiped his feet off with her hair. The house was filled with the ointment’s fragrance. %u@4Judas Iscariot, one of his disciples, the one who was going to facilitate his arrest, then says, %u@5”Why exactly wasn’t the ointment sold for $30,000 and the proceeds donated to the poor?” %u@6Now he didn’t make this remark about the poor because he gave a hoot about them, but because he was a thief and, being in charge of the purse, carried the donations around non-stop. %u@7So Jesus said to him, %r@“%R@L%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@m%r@e%r@m%r@o%r@r%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@g%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@e%r@m%r@b%r@a%r@l%r@m%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@l%r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@9A huge crowd discovered that he was there in Bethany, and they came by, and not just because of Jesus but also so that they could catch a glimpse of Lazarus, whom he raised from the dead. %u@1%u@0Now the chief priests determined to kill Lazarus too, %u@1%u@1because, on account of him, many of the Judeans kept on departing from their tutelage and believing in Jesus.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2The next day, the huge crowd which had come to the festival heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem, %u@1%u@3took branches off palm trees, went out to meet him, and loudly chanted over and over,%vn~
%si~
Rescue us!%vp~
Blessed is he who comes at the Lord’s behest%vp~
The king of Israel, oh yeah!%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@4Jesus acquired a not-yet-fully-grown donkey and mounted it, according to what’s recorded in Scripture:%nn~
%si~
%u@1%u@5Don’t be afraid%vp~
Fair citizens of that glorious land over the rainbow%vp~
Take a look—your king’s coming%vp~
Mounted on a donkey colt%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@6His disciples didn’t understand this at first, but when Jesus was glorified, they then remembered that these things were written in exact reference to him and that these things were done for him by them.%nn~
          %u@1%u@7So then the crowd that was with him when he summoned Lazarus from the tomb and raised him from the dead kept attesting to the miracle’s validity. %u@1%u@8This is also the reason that the crowd converged on him: it’s because they heard that he had performed this miracle. %u@1%u@9So the Pharisees said amongst themselves, “As you can see, nothing we’re doing is working out. Take a look—the world’s gone chasing after him to be his follower.”%vn~
          %u@2%u@0Now some of those who went down to Jerusalem to worship in the festival consisted of Greek-speaking Jews. %u@2%u@1These people approached Philip of Bethsaida, Galilee and asked him, “Sir, we’d like to see Jesus.” %u@2%u@2Philip then goes and speaks to Andrew, and both go and speak to Jesus. %u@2%u@3Jesus’s reply is, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@M%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@f%r@i%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@p%r@p%r@r%r@o%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@”%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@t%r@o%r@-%r@g%r@o%r@o%r@d%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@u%r@t%r@h%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@—%r@i%r@f%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@f%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@r%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@           %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%r@”%R@A%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@f%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@q%r@u%r@i%r@t%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@—%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@,%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@?%r@—%R@S%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@u%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@r%r@o%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@?%r@—%R@N%r@o%r@,%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@t%r@r%r@a%r@r%r@y%r@:%r@ %r@i%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@r%r@r%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@8%R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@g%r@l%r@o%r@r%r@i%r@f%r@y%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@p%r@u%r@t%r@a%r@t%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@Y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@.%r@”%r@ Then a voice from heaven came forth,%vn~
%si~
Having glorified it already, I will glorify it yet again%vp~
—I will do both, not just one or the other%vp~
%si~
          %u@2%u@9So then, the crowd which was standing there listening proceeded to say that thunder had occurred, but others proceeded to say, “An angel has spoken to him.” %u@3%u@0Jesus responded in this manner, %r@“%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@v%r@o%r@i%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@d%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@c%r@c%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@n%r@e%r@f%r@i%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@N%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@v%r@e%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@g%r@a%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@l%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@y%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@u%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@u%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@,%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@m%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@R%r@u%r@l%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %R@S%r@y%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@m%r@ %R@T%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@H%r@u%r@m%r@a%r@n%r@ %R@R%r@a%r@c%r@e%r@ %R@L%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %R@U%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@o%r@o%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@A%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@s%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@u%r@p%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@a%r@l%r@l%r@y%r@ %r@e%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@y%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@s%r@e%r@l%r@f%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
          %u@3%u@3In the course of saying this, he was signifying the sort of death he would die, a death lingering over him. %u@3%u@4Then the crowd replied, “The Old Testament tells us that the Messiah (the Christ) remains here on Earth forever and ever, so how can you say that the Man must be hoisted up and killed?” %u@3%u@5Jesus told them, “%R@T%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@r%r@e%r@m%r@a%r@i%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@t%r@t%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@o%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@.%r@ %R@W%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@(%r@i%r@.%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@d%r@u%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@r%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@)%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@o%r@u%r@g%r@h%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@e%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@w%r@n%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@u%r@p%r@p%r@r%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@.%r@ %R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@l%r@k%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@r%r@k%r@n%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@w%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@g%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@A%r@s%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@i%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@m%r@b%r@o%r@d%r@i%r@m%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@.%r@”%r@%vn~
      Jesus spoke these things, departed, and concealed himself from them. %u@3%u@7Though he performed so many miracles right in front of them, they still wouldn’t believe in him, %u@3%u@8in order that the quotation from the Prophet Isaiah would be fulfilled, in which he said,%vn~
%si~
Lord, who believed our report?%vp~
And to whom has the Lord’s capabilities and actions been revealed?%vp~
%si~
%u@3%u@9They weren’t able to believe because of what Isaiah said in addition to that,%nn~
%si~
%u@4%u@0He has blinded their eyes%vp~
And hardened their hearts%vp~
So that they won’t be able to see with their eyes%vp~
And intelligently think things through in the heart%vp~
And turn from their ways%vp~
And be healed by Me%vp~
%si~
%u@4%u@1Isaiah said these things because he saw His glory and spoke about Him. %u@4%u@2Nevertheless, many of the rulers believed in him in spite of what Isaiah prophesied, but wouldn’t profess their belief because of the Pharisees, lest they get excommunicated. %u@4%u@3The fact is, they loved and cherished the pride and joy that mankind revels in more than the pride and joy which God revels in.%nn~
          %u@4%u@4Jesus cried out, %r@“%R@H%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@e%r@s%r@n%r@’%r@t%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@a%r@d%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@l%r@i%r@e%r@v%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@O%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@4%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@5%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@h%r@o%r@l%r@d%r@s%r@
