%r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@9%R@A%r@s%r@ %r@m%r@a%r@n%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@i%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@u%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@i%r@r%r@ %r@f%r@l%r@a%r@w%r@s%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@r%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@u%r@l%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@i%r@l%r@d%r@.%r@ %R@S%r@o%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@g%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@a%r@n%r@g%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@y%r@s%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@0%R@S%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@—%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@s%r@t%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@c%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@f%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@p%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@k%r@n%r@o%r@c%r@k%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@s%r@o%r@u%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@o%r@p%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@o%r@r%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@t%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@h%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@j%r@o%r@y%r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@h%r@i%r@m%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%R@T%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@r%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@l%r@l%r@ %r@g%r@r%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@e%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@,%r@ %r@a%r@s%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@n%r@q%r@u%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@v%r@e%r@r%r@c%r@o%r@m%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@a%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@e%r@a%r@t%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@w%r@i%r@t%r@h%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %R@F%r@a%r@t%r@h%r@e%r@r%r@ %r@b%r@y%r@ %R@H%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@r%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@.%r@%vn~
          %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%r@”%r@’%R@I%r@f%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@’%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@a%r@b%r@l%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@a%r@k%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@a%r@r%r@t%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@a%r@i%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@l%r@i%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@a%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@S%r@p%r@i%r@r%r@i%r@t%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@e%r@l%r@l%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@u%r@r%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@’%r@”%r@%vn~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 4%hb~
          %u@1After all of this I looked, and—just like that—a door up in the sky had been opened, and the first voice I heard was speaking to me like a trumpet does when sounding an alert, saying, “Come up here and I’ll show you what must come to pass after these things.” %u@2Immediately I wound up in the Spirit and—just like that—a throne was situated there in the sky, and someone was sitting on the throne, %u@3and the one sitting looked like he was made of stone, of jasper and sardius, and a rainbow that looked just like emerald went around the throne. %u@4And twenty-four smaller thrones surrounded the one throne, and upon the smaller thrones were seated twenty-four elders dressed in white and upon their heads were golden laurels, victors’ crowns. %u@5Out of the one throne came thunder and lightning. Seven lamps of fire burned before the throne, and these are the seven Spirits of God. %u@6And before the throne there was a glass lake like crystal.%vn~
      In the midst of the throne and around the throne were four animal-like creatures, with eyes all over them on the front and on the back. %u@7The first creature was like a lion, the second like a calf, the third had the face of a man, the fourth was like a flying eagle. %u@8And each one of the four creatures had six wings, and they were full of eyes around them and inside of them. Day and night they never stopped saying,%vn~
%si~
Holy, holy, holy%vp~
Lord God Almighty%vp~
Who was, Who is, Who’s coming%vp~
%si~
          %u@9And when the creatures give glory, honor, and thanksgiving to the One seated on the throne, to the One who lives forever and ever, %u@1%u@0the twenty-four elders fall and prostrate themselves before the One sitting on the throne and worship the One who lives forever and ever, and toss their wreaths before the throne saying,%vn~
%si~
%u@1%u@1You are worthy, our Lord God%vp~
To receive the glory, the honor, and the power%vp~
Because You created all things%vp~
And by means of Your will%vp~
They were determined to be and were created%vp~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 5%hb~
          %u@1And I saw a scroll in the right hand of the of the One sitting on the throne, and the scroll was full of writing on both the front and back sides and was sealed shut with seven seals. %u@2I saw a powerful angel proclaiming in a loud voice, “Who’s worthy to break the seals and open the scroll?” %u@3They kept trying to find someone who was able to, and they couldn’t find anyone in heaven, on the earth, nor in the underworld of death to open the scroll or to even look at it. %u@4They proceeded to weep intensely since nobody was found worthy enough to open the scroll or to even look at it. %u@5But one of the elders then tells me, “Don’t cry. Look here—the lion of the tribe of Judah, from the shoot of David, has prevailed in earning the right to break the seven seals and open the scroll.”%vn~
          %u@6In the midst of the throne and the four creatures and in the midst of the elders, I saw a lamb standing there looking as though he had been slain, having seven horns seven eyes, which are the Seven Spirits of God which have been sent out all over the planet. %u@7He came and took what was in the right hand of the One sitting on the throne, %u@8and when he took the scroll, the four creatures and the twenty-four elders fell and prostrated themselves before the lamb, each of them having a harp and a golden vial of incense, which are the prayers of those who are holy. %u@9And they sing a new song saying in it,%vn~
%si~
You are worthy to take the scroll%vp~
And to break open its seals%vp~
Because you were slain and with your blood%vp~
Purchased for God those%vp~
From among every clan, language, culture, and ethnicity.%vp~
%u@1%u@0And you made them into a priestly kingdom for our God,%vp~
And they will reign upon the earth.%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@1I looked and heard a sound of many angels surrounding the throne and of the creatures and elders. There were millions and millions and billions and billions in number, %u@1%u@2all saying in a loud voice,%vn~
%si~
Worthy is the slain lamb to receive%vp~
The power and wealth and wisdom and strength%vp~
And honor and glory and thanksgiving due him%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@3I heard all of creation that’s in the sky, on the earth, below the earth, on top of the sea, and beneath the sea saying,%nn~
%si~
To the One sitting upon the throne and to the lamb%vp~
Be the thanksgiving, honor, glory, might%vp~
Forever and ever%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@4The four creatures proceeded to say, “So be it,” and the elders fell and prostrated themselves and offered up worship.%nn~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 6%hb~
          %u@1And I looked when the lamb broke one of the seven seals, and I heard one of the four creatures in a voice like thunder say, “Come!” %u@2…And I looked and—like that—a white horse appeared, and the one mounted on it had a bow, and he had been given a victor’s wreath, and he went forth conquering and attempting to conquer.%vn~
          %u@3When he broke the second seal, from out of the second creature I heard, “Come!” %u@4…And another horse, a red one, appeared, and the one mounted on it was granted to take the peace away from the planet, so that people will kill each other, and he was given a large sword.%vn~
          %u@5When he broke the third seal, from out of the third creature I heard, “Come!” …And I looked and—like that—a black horse appeared, and the one mounted on it had a scale in his hand. %u@6I heard a voice in the midst of the four creatures saying, “Set the price of wheat at $100 per quart/950 ml and barley at $35 per quart, and don’t tamper with the prices of olive oil and wine.”%vn~
          %u@7When he opened the fourth seal, I heard the fourth creature’s voice say, “Come!” %u@8…And I looked and—like that—a pale horse appeared, and the one mounted on it is named Death and trailing just behind him is Graveyard. They were given control of one-quarter of the Earth, to kill it by sword, by famine, by the plague, and by indigenous wild animals.%vn~
          %u@9When the fifth seal was broken, I saw the lives of those who had been slain on account of the word of God and the profession of faith that they maintained, which was public knowledge, under the altar. %u@1%u@0A loud voice cried out, “Just how long, Holy and True Master, will You continue to refrain from delivering a verdict that will vindicate and avenge our blood, taking it out on Earth’s current inhabitants?” %u@1%u@1Each of them was given a white robe, and they were told that they’ll have to wait a bit longer yet, until the quota is filled with their fellow-servants, their comrades, and those who are going to be killed like they too were.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2I looked when the sixth seal was broken, and a severe earthquake occurred, and the sun turned as black as burlap made out of hair, and the whole moon turned into something like the color of blood, %u@1%u@3and the stars in the night sky fell to the ground like a fig tree shedding its unripe figs when shaken by a strong wind, %u@1%u@4and the sky split apart like a scroll getting rolled up, and every mountain and every island in their vicinity was displaced. %u@1%u@5The kings of the Earth, the high-status noblemen, the generals, the wealthy, the mighty, the slaves and the free hid themselves in caves and in the rocks of the mountains. %u@1%u@6They then proceed to say to the mountains and to the rocks, “Fall on us and hide us from the undivided attention of the One sitting on the throne and from the wrath of the lamb, %u@1%u@7because the Great Day of their wrath has arrived, and who can withstand it?”%vn~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 7%hb~
          %u@1After these things I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, holding back the four winds of the earth, so that the winds couldn’t blow over the land, over the sea, or over any forest. %u@2And I saw another angel coming over from the East, where the sun rises, having the living God’s seal of approval, and he shouted to the four angels in a loud voice, the angels who were granted to trash the land and the sea, %u@3“Don’t trash the land, the sea, or the forests until we get to put a seal of approval upon the foreheads of God’s servants.” %u@4And I heard what the number of those who were sealed is—144,000—sealed from among all the sons of Israel:%vn~
%si~
%u@5From the tribe of Judah: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Reuben: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Gad: 12,000%vp~
%u@6From the tribe of Asher: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Naphtali: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Manasseh: 12,000%vp~
%u@7From the tribe of Simeon: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Levi: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Issachar: 12,000%vp~
%u@8From the tribe of Zebulon: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Joseph: 12,000%vp~
From the tribe of Benjamin: 12,000%vp~
%si~
          %u@9After these things I looked and—like that—a large crowd, the size of which is unknown, from every ethnicity, clan, culture, and language was brought to stand before the throne and before the lamb, and they were clothed in white robes and had palm branches in their hands, %u@1%u@0and were crying out in a loud voice,%vn~
%si~
The protection we enjoy we attribute to our God%vp~
Who’s seated upon the throne%vp~
And by the lamb%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@1And all the angels who were stood around the throne, the elders, and the four creatures fell on their faces before God and worshipped Him %u@1%u@2saying,%nn~
%si~
We heartily agree:%vp~
The blessing, the glory, the wisdom, the thanksgiving,%vp~
The honor, the power, and the might%vp~
We attribute to our God forever and ever.%vp~
So be it.%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@3One of the elders reflected upon this and said to me,%vn~
      “These people who are wearing the white robes—who are they and what are they all about?”%vn~
          %u@1%u@4I told him, “My good fellow, you know the answer.”%vn~
      And he told me, “These are the ones coming out of the Great Tribulation and who have washed their robes by bleaching them in the blood of the lamb.”%vn~
%si~
%u@1%u@5Because of this they are before God’s throne%vp~
In His very presence, the center of His attention%vp~
And perform a worship of religious service to Him%vp~
Day and night in His temple.%vp~
And the one sitting on the throne%vp~
Will set up camp among them.%vp~
%u@1%u@6They will not ever again hunger or thirst,%vp~
Nor will the sun beat down upon them%vp~
Nor any scorching heat,%vp~
%u@1%u@7Because the lamb on high in the midst of the throne%vp~
Shepherds them and will take them%vp~
Down a path to a spring of living water,%vp~
And God has wiped every tear away from their eyes.%vp~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 8%hb~
          %u@1When he broke the seventh seal, it became silent in heaven for about a half-hour. %u@2And I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and seven trumpets were given to them.%vn~
          %u@3Another angel who had in his possession a golden incense dispenser came and was ushered over and made to stand upon the altar. He was given a lot of incense so that he would offer up upon the golden altar that is before God incense in the form of the prayers of all the set-apart-people. %u@4And the smoke of the incense which consists of the prayers of the set-apart-people went up from the hand of the angel who was before God. %u@5And the angel methodically and deliberately took the incense dispenser and filled it with some of the hot coals from the altar and flung it on the ground, and thunder and lightning, various sounds, and an earthquake occurred.%vn~
          %u@6The seven angels who have the seven trumpets got ready to sound alerts by blowing the trumpets. %u@7The first one blew his trumpet and it hailed, as fire mixed in with blood was hurled to the earth. A third of the trees were incinerated as well as all of the grass which was still growing.%vn~
          %u@8The second angel blew his trumpet, and something like a huge mountain consisting of a burning coal was thrown into the sea, and a third of the sea turned into blood, %u@9and a third of the living creatures in the sea died, and a third of the ships were destroyed.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0The third angel blew his trumpet, and a huge star burning like a torch fell from the sky and onto a third of the rivers and upon the springs of waters. %u@1%u@1The star’s called Bitter-Flavoring: a third of the water became bitter, and many people died from the water, because it became poisonous due to its having been made bitter.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2The fourth angel blew his trumpet, and a third of the sun, a third of the moon, and a third of the stars were struck, for the purpose of causing a third of them to go dark and causing no light to shine during the day a third of the time and likewise neither moonlight nor starlight a third of the time at night.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3I looked, and I heard a certain vulture flying very high up in the sky saying in a loud voice, “Woe, woe, woe to the inhabitants of the Earth from the sounds of the remaining trumpets which the three angels are going to blow.%vn~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 9%hb~
          %u@1The fifth angel blew his horn, and I saw a star which had fallen and landed on the Earth, and he (the star) was given the key to the bottomless pit. %u@2He opened the bottomless pit, and smoke came out of the pit, like smoke from a gigantic furnace. The sun was blotted out by the fumes from the smoke which came from the pit. %u@3From out of the smoke locusts went forth over the land, and they were granted capabilities that even scorpions don’t have. %u@4They were told not to harm the grass, nor any of the greenery, nor any of the trees—only to harm the people who don’t have God’s seal upon their foreheads. %u@5They were not granted permission to kill them, but instead were granted permission to torment them for five months—and the pain they inflict is like when a scorpion stings a person. %u@6When that time comes around, people will wish they were dead but will not be so lucky, and they’ll feel like they’re dying but death is nevertheless evading them.%vn~
          %u@7The locusts looked like horses dressed for battle. Upon their heads was something like a golden cap; their faces were like the face of a person; %u@8they had hair like a woman’s hair; their teeth were like a lion’s teeth; %u@9and they had breastplates like iron. The sound they made when flying sounds like a multitude of horses charging into battle. %u@1%u@0They have tails like scorpions with stingers in them, and they were given a mandate to hurt people with their tails for five months. %u@1%u@1A king rules over them, the angel of the abyss; his name in Hebrew is Abaddon and in Greek is Apollyon (i.e. Destruction).%vn~
          %u@1%u@2The first woe is over; look out, there’s two more woes coming!%vn~
          %u@1%u@3The sixth angel blew his trumpet, and I heard a voice from the four horns of the golden altar which is before God %u@1%u@4say, “To the sixth angel who has the trumpet: release the four angels who are on top of the Greater Euphrates River who’ve been restrained.” %u@1%u@5And the four angels who had been prepared for this very moment to kill a third of mankind were released. %u@1%u@6The number of soldiers in the cavalry was two hundred million—that’s the number I heard. %u@1%u@7This is what the horses and the cavalry soldiers mounted on them looked like in the vision: they have red, purple, and yellow breastplates, and the horses’ hair is like a lion’s hair, and fire, smoke, and a sulfurous residue known as brimstone comes out of their mouths.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8From these three curses one-third of mankind was killed—from the fire, smoke, and brimstone which comes out of their mouths; %u@1%u@9the fact is, the horses’ power is in their mouths and in their tails, seeing that their tails are like a snake having a head to inflict harm with. %vn~
          %u@2%u@0The remainder of mankind who weren’t killed by these curses didn’t repent either of the deeds of their hands, so that they wouldn’t worship demons and idols of gold, silver, and copper, those things that can neither see, hear, or walk around. %u@2%u@1They wouldn’t repent of their murders, their recreational drug use, their fornication, or their thievery.%vn~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 10%hb~
          %u@1I saw another angel, a powerful one, coming down out of the sky with a cloud wrapped around him and a rainbow on his head. His face was like the sun, and his feet were like pillars of fire. %u@2In his hand was a little scroll which had been opened. He put his right foot on the sea and his left on the land, %u@3and cried out in a loud voice just like a roaring lion. When he cried out, the seven thunders spoke their own voices. %u@4And when the seven thunders spoke, I was about to start writing it down, and I heard a voice from the sky say, “Record the fact that what the seven thunders spoke is genuine, but don’t write down what they said.”%vn~
          %u@5The angel whom I saw standing on sea and land raised his right hand all the way up %u@6and swore an oath by Him who lives forever and ever, Who created the sky and the things in it, the land and the things in it, and the sea and the things in it, that there’ll be no further delay. %u@7To the contrary, it’ll take place in the timeframe of the voice of the seventh angel, when he’s about to blow his trumpet and God’s mystery will be concluded, and it will turn out the way He proclaimed the glowing details to His own servants the prophets.%vn~
          %u@8The voice which I heard from out of the sky proceeded to speak to me once again, “Go over and take the opened book which is in the hand of the angel standing on sea and land.” %u@9I left and went to the angel to tell him to give me the little scroll, and he then says to me, “Take it and eat it. It will upset your stomach, but will be as sweet as honey in your mouth.” %u@1%u@0I took the little scroll from the angel’s hand and ate it all up, and it was as sweet as honey in my mouth, but when I swallowed it, it upset my stomach. %u@1%u@1They then tell me, “You must yet again prophesy in about many cultures, ethnicities, languages, and kings.”%vn~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 11%hb~
          %u@1I was given a yardstick the size of a staff, while being told, “Get up and measure the temple of God, the altar, and the worshippers in it, %u@2but exclude the outer courtyard from the measurement, since it’s been given to the Gentiles; the Holy City will be treated with utter contempt for 42 months. %u@3And I will give the nod to my two witnesses and they will prophesy for 1260 days while dressed in burlap signifying mourning.”%vn~
          %u@4These individuals are the two olive trees and the two lamps which stand before the Lord of the Earth. %u@5And if at any given moment someone wants to harm them, fire comes out of their mouths and devours their enemies. And if at any given moment someone would want to harm them, this someone must be killed in this manner. %u@6These individuals have the authority to plug up the sky, so that it won’t rain over the timespan which they specify in prophesy, and they have authority over the waters to turn them into blood and over the land to smite the land with any kind of calamity, should they so desire.%vn~
          %u@7When they do finish their public declaration, the beasts which come up out of the abyss will wage war with them, defeat them, and kill them. %u@8Their corpses will be left lying on the main boulevard of the Great City, which, from a spiritual perspective, is called That Worldly Land of Captivity Sodom, also where the Lord was crucified. %u@9And various ones from among the cultures, the clans, the languages, and the ethnicities will then see their corpses for three-and-a-half days and won’t be permitted to lay their bodies in a tomb. %u@1%u@0The inhabitants of the Earth will rejoice over them and be glad, and they’ll exchange gifts with one another, because this pair of prophets tormented the inhabitants of the Earth.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1I watched events unfold. After the three-and-a-half days, a spirit of life sent from God entered them, and they stood on their feet, and a tremendous sort of fear fell upon those watching what was happening to them. %u@1%u@2They heard a loud voice from out of the sky, originating from heaven, say to them, “Come up here,” and they went up into the sky in the cloud used to transport them, and their enemies watched them. %u@1%u@3Just about then, a severe earthquake occurred, a tenth of the city collapsed, seven thousand citizens were killed by the earthquake, and the remainder became fearful and finally admitted to their guilt.%vn~
          %u@1%u@4The second woe is over; look out—the third woe comes right on its heels!%vn~
          %u@1%u@5The seventh angel blew his trumpet, and loud voices started to be heard in heaven saying,%vn~
%si~
The kingdom of the established order of our Lord%vp~
Has come to pass,%vp~
And of His Messiah, the Christ.%vp~
And He will reign forever and ever.%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@6The twenty-four elders who are seated upon their thrones before God fell on their faces and worshipped God %u@1%u@7saying,%vn~
%si~
We thank you Lord God Almighty%vp~
Who is and Who was,%vp~
Because You have taken your Great, Miraculous Power%vp~
And have begun to reign with it.%vp~
%u@1%u@8And the nations became enraged,%vp~
And Your wrath came,%vp~
And with it the right time for the dead to be judged%vp~
And to give to Your servants the prophets%vp~
The wage they earned%vp~
And to the set-apart-people%vp~
And to the nobodies and the great%vp~
Who are awestruck by who You are%vp~
And to destroy those who are destroying the Earth.%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@9God’s heavenly temple was opened, the ark of His covenant was seen in His temple, and thunder and lightning, earthquakes, and hailstone occurred.%vn~

Revelation Chapter 12%hb~
          %u@1A great portent was seen in heaven: a woman clothed in the sun, the moon under her feet, a crown with twelve stars on her head, %u@2and with a baby in her womb, screaming because of labor pains, the agony of giving birth. %u@3I saw another portent in heaven, and—out of nowhere—a huge red dragon with seven heads and ten horns and with ornamental headbands on his head. %u@4His tail swept a third of the stars, dragging them until he’d completely gotten ahold of them, and flung them to the Earth.%vn~
      The dragon stood before the woman who was about to give birth, so that he could devour the child when she gives birth. %u@5She gave birth to a son—a male-child—who would some day shepherd (rule) every nation with an iron staff. Her child was snatched away from her and taken to God and to His throne. %u@6The woman fled to the backcountry, where nobody was around, where, by God’s direction, a place in it had been prepared for her, so that she would be taken care of for 1260 days, allowing her to recuperate.%vn~
          %u@7A war occurred in heaven: Michael and his angels waged war with the dragon, and the dragon and his angels waged war against him. %u@8But he was not powerful enough, nor could he establish a foothold in heaven, %u@9and the Great Dragon, the Ancient Serpent, the one called “Slanderer” (i.e. “the Devil”)—yes indeed: Satan—the one who deceives the entire inhabited world—he was driven to the Earth, and his angels too were driven out with him. %u@1%u@0I heard a loud voice in heaven saying,%vn~
%si~
The end of our misery, the security, the power,%vp~
The kingdom of our God,%vp~
And the authority of His Messiah, His Christ%vp~
Starts right now,%vp~
Since our comrades’ accuser has been driven out,%vp~
The one who accuses them before our God day and night.%vp~
%u@1%u@1And they defeated him by means of the lamb’s blood%vp~
And the logic of his solemn declaration.%vp~
They didn’t love their life%vp~
Even to the point of death.%vp~
%u@1%u@2On account of this be glad:%vp~
You the sky, the atmosphere, outer space, and heaven%vp~
And those who are camped out in you—%vp~
Woe to the land and sea%vp~
Because the devil’s headed your way filled with rage,%vp~
Knowing that he has only a small window of time left.%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@3And when the dragon saw that he was driven to the Earth, he pursued the woman who gave birth to the man-child. %u@1%u@4The woman was given a pair of giant vulture wings, so that she could fly to the place set aside for her in the backcountry, where she is taken care of three-and-a-half years, kept away from the serpent’s single-minded focus. %u@1%u@5The serpent spewed water like a river from his mouth, going after the woman by making a torrent that would sweep her away; %u@1%u@6but the land came to the woman’s aid: the ground opened its mouth and drank the river up which the dragon spewed out of his mouth. %u@1%u@7The dragon became furious with the woman and went off to wage war with the remainder of her offspring, those who keep God’s commandments and who have something to attest to as far as Jesus is concerned.%vn~
          %u@1%u@8And the dragon stood on the seashore…%vn~

Revelation Chapter 13%hb~
%u@1…And I saw a beast come out of the sea, one who has ten horns, seven heads, and seven ornamental headbands on his horns, and I saw the name “blasphemy” on his heads. %u@2The beast which I saw was like a leopard, his feet were like bear claws, and his mouth was like a lion’s mouth. The dragon gave him his power, his throne, and extensive authority. %u@3One of his heads seemed to be mortally wounded by having had its throat slit, but his mortal wound had been successfully treated. The whole earth was in total awe of the beast, %u@4and they worshipped the dragon because he gave the previously mentioned authority to the beast, and they worshipped the beast saying, “Who can match the beast, and who can go to war with him and stand a chance against him?”%nn~
          %u@5He was given a mouth to speak completely over-the-top blasphemies, and he was given authority to act for forty-two months. %u@6He opened his mouth to blaspheme God, to blaspheme His reputation, everything He stands for, the place He calls home, and those who call heaven home. %u@7He was granted to wage war with the set-apart-people and to conquer them, and he was granted authority over every clan, every culture, those who share a common dialect, and every ethnic group. %u@8Everyone on the planet will worship him, that is all those whose names haven’t been recorded in the Lamb’s Book of Life from day-one, the lamb who was slain.%vn~
      %vn~
%u@9A word to the wise is sufficient:%nn~
%si~
%u@1%u@0If someone is destined to captivity,%vp~
To captivity he heads.%vp~
If someone is to be killed by a sword,%vp~
Killed by a sword he will.%vp~
%si~
There you have it: the perseverance and the faith of the set-apart-people.%nn~
      %vn~
          %u@1%u@1I saw another beast come out of the ground, and he had two horns like a lamb but talks like a dragon. %u@1%u@2He exercises all the first beast’s authority under his supervision. He makes it so that the Earth and those who inhabit it would worship the First Beast, the one who was healed of his mortal wound. %u@1%u@3He performs spectacular miracles, to the extent that he can even make flames come down from out of the sky all the way to the ground in front of people. %u@1%u@4And he deceives the inhabitants of the Earth by means of the miracles that were granted to him under the beast’s supervision, telling the inhabitants of the Earth to make a replica of the beast who had the sword wound but lived through it.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5It was granted to him to give life-essence to the beast’s replica, so that the replica could both talk and could cause those who choose not to worship the replica to be killed. %u@1%u@6And he makes everyone—the nobodies and the great, the rich and the poor, the free and the slave—have a mark put on their right hand or on their forehead, %u@1%u@7so that any given person won’t be able to make a purchase or be able to sell a thing except if such person has the mark, specifically the beast’s name or the number of his name. %u@1%u@8Here’s the tricky part: let he who’s mentally proficient in dealing with large numbers count the beast’s number, for it is a man’s number, and his number is 666.%vn~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 14%hb~
          %u@1I looked and—like that—the lamb was standing there at Mt. Zion and with him 144,000 who have his name and the name of his Father written upon their foreheads. %u@2I heard a voice from heaven, a voice like a large volume of rushing water and like loud thunder. The voice I heard was like singing-harpists who are singing and playing their harps at the same time. %u@3They sing a new song before the throne and before the four creatures and the elders. No one was able to learn the song except for the 144,000, they who were purchased from the Earth. %u@4These are ones who haven’t defiled themselves with women, for they are virgins; these people follow the lamb wherever he goes; these people were purchased from mankind, cherry-picked from the pool of all humans and offered as the best-of-the-best to God and to the lamb. %u@5No lie is to be found in their mouths; they are without blemish.%vn~
          %u@6I saw another angel flying way, way up in the sky having an eternal proclamation of good news to deliver to those sitting on the Earth, to every ethnicity, clan, language, and culture, %u@7saying in a loud voice, “Fear God and come clean with Him, since the time for His judgments has arrived. Worship the One who made the sky, the land, the sea, and the springs of water.”%vn~
          %u@8Another angel—a second one—trailed behind saying, “Fallen! Fallen! Babylon the Great—the one whom all nations have drunk from her supply of wine, drinking of the wine of the ferocity of her fornication.”%vn~
          %u@9Another angel—a third one—trailed them saying in a loud voice, “If one worships the beast and his replica and receives the mark on his forehead or on his hand, %u@1%u@0this very person drinks from out of the wine of the wrath of God, the undiluted mixture of wine which is in the cup of His wrath, and will be tormented by fire and brimstone under the scrutiny of some holy angels and under the scrutiny of the lamb. %u@1%u@1The smoke of their torment billows up forever and ever, non-stop day and night, the torment of they who worship the beast and his replica, and of any given person if he were to have received the mark of his name.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@2There you have it: the perseverance of the set-apart-people, those who keep God’s commandments and the faith of Jesus.%vn~
          %u@1%u@3I heard a voice from out of the sky say, “Write this down: ‘Blessed be the dead who believe in and serve the Lord who are killed from here on out. Yes indeed,’ says the Spirit, ‘so that they might rest from their toil. The fact is, as they parade in, their deeds are showcased.’”%vn~
          %u@1%u@4I looked, and—out of nowhere—a white cloud appeared, and seated on the cloud was someone who looked like a perfectly-proportioned man—the ideal man—possessing a golden crown on his head and a sharp sickle in his hand. %u@1%u@5And another angel came out of the temple while crying out in a loud voice to the one sitting on the cloud, “Get out in the field and get to it with the sickle and reap the entire field, because the time has come to reap it entirely, since the timing is perfect to reap the earth’s harvest.” %u@1%u@6So the man sitting on the cloud took his sickle down to the Earth and reaped the Earth.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7Another angel came out of the heavenly temple, he too having a sharp sickle of his own. %u@1%u@8And another angel came out of the altar, the one in control of the flames of the altar and in a loud voice hollered to one with the sharp sickle, “Get out there with your sharp sickle and gather the grapes from the vineyard of the Earth, because her grape clusters have ripened.” %u@1%u@9And the angel took his sickle to the Earth and gathered the grapes from the Earth and took them to the Great Winepress of God’s wrath. %u@2%u@0The winepress was tread outside the city, and blood flowed out of the winepress creating a stream about shoulder-high and stretching out 200 miles/300 km.%vn~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 15%hb~
          %u@1I saw another portent in heaven, huge and quite a sight to see: seven angels with the last of the seven plagues, the last because with them God’s wrath is complete.%vn~
          %u@2I saw something like a glass sea mixed with flames, and the ones who prevailed against the onslaught of the beast, against his replica, and against the number of his name standing there at the glass sea, in possession of God’s harps. %u@3They sang the song of Moses, the servant of God, and the song of the lamb saying,%vn~
%si~
Great and Marvelous are Your works,%vp~
Lord God Almighty,%vp~
Righteous and true are Your ways,%vp~
King of the nations.%vp~
%u@4Who does not fear and reverence You%vp~
To the utmost extent,%vp~
To the point of fearing you, Lord?%vp~
Because You alone are pious%vp~
Since all the nations will come%vp~
And worship before You,%vp~
Since Your righteousness has been made manifest.%vp~
%si~
          %u@5After these things, I looked and saw that the temple housing the Great Declaration in heaven was opened, %u@6and the seven angels, the ones in possession of the seven plagues, left the temple clothed in clean, bright linen and with golden sashes wrapped around their chests. %u@7One of the four creatures gave the seven angels seven golden bowls that were filled to the brim, and the source they were filled from is the wrath of the God who lives forever and ever. %u@8The temple was filled up with smoke, and the source of the smoke is God’s glory and His power. No one was able to enter the temple until the seven plagues of the seven angels happened to finish.%vn~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 16%hb~
          %u@1I heard a loud voice coming out of the temple telling the angels, “Go forth and pour out the seven bowls of God’s wrath onto the Earth.”%vn~
          %u@2The first one departed and poured out his bowl onto the Earth, and a wicked-bad sore showed up on the people who have the mark of the beast and who worship his replica.%vn~
          %u@3The second one poured out his bowl onto the sea, and it turned into blood, the blood like a dead person has, and all living beings in the sea died.%vn~
          %u@4The third one poured out his bowl on the rivers and on the springs of water, and the water turned into blood. %u@5I heard the angel who affected the waters say,%vn~
%si~
You are correct%vp~
You Who is and Who was—You Who are pious,%vp~
%u@6Because saints’ and prophets’ blood has been spilled,%vp~
And You’ve given them blood to drink up.%vp~
They deserve it.%vp~
%si~
%u@7And from the altar I heard someone say,%nn~
%si~
      Yes indeed, Lord God Almighty%vn~
      True and correct are Your judgments%vn~
%si~
          %u@8The fourth one poured his bowl out upon the sun, and it was granted the ability to scorch mankind in flames, %u@9and mankind was scorched something fierce. They blasphemed God’s reputation and everything He stands for—He who has control over all these plagues—and they wouldn’t have a change of heart and come clean with Him.%vn~
          %u@1%u@0The fifth one poured his bowl out upon the beast’s throne, and his kingdom suddenly darkened, and they proceeded to bite their tongues as a result of the pain caused by the angel. %u@1%u@1As a result of their pain and their sores, they blasphemed the God of heaven, but they wouldn’t stop doing the deeds they were doing.%vn~
          %u@1%u@2The sixth one poured out his bowl upon the Greater Euphrates River, and all its water dried up, in order to form the road that the kings who come from the East will use. %u@1%u@3And I saw three harassing, demonic spirits like frogs come out of the dragon’s mouth, the beast’s mouth, and the false prophet’s mouth; %u@1%u@4in fact, the demon spirits perform miracles that go exactly to the kings of the entire inhabited world, to gather them to the war of the Great Day of God Almighty.%vn~
%si~
%u@1%u@5See here now: I’m coming like a thief.%vp~
Blessed is he who stays focused%vp~
And retains his clothing%vp~
So that he won’t walk about naked%vp~
And be exposed to ridicule.%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@6And they were gathered to the place called “Armageddon” in Hebrew.%nn~
          %u@1%u@7The seventh angel poured his bowl out upon the lower atmosphere, and a loud voice came out of the temple saying, “It has come into being,” %u@1%u@8and thunder and lightning and strange sounds occurred, plus an earthquake occurred—a big one—the likes of which have never happened on the Earth before since the beginning of the human race—that’s how enormous it was. %u@1%u@9The Great City split into three parts, and the major cities of the nations fell. God wasn’t going to let Babylon the Great slip by and not dole out to her the cup of the wine of his fierce wrath. %u@2%u@0Everyone living on an island fled, and nobody could be found up in the mountains. %u@2%u@1Huge hailstones that weighed about 75 lbs/34 kg rained down from the sky upon mankind, and as a result of the plague of hail, the human race blasphemed God, since the plague in and of itself was severe—really severe.%vn~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 17%hb~
          %u@1One of the seven angels who has the seven bowls came and spoke with me saying, “Come, I’ll show you the verdict rendered against the Great Harlot who sits upon many different waters, %u@2she whom the kings of the Earth fornicated with, and she whom the inhabitants of the Earth got drunk off the wine of her fornication.” %u@3He took me up to an uninhabited, desolate place in the Spirit. I saw a woman sitting on a scarlet beast, a beast plastered with blasphemous names, a woman who has seven heads and ten horns. %u@4The woman was clothed in the purple clothing that the wealthy wear and in luxurious scarlet and was adorned in gold, gemstones, and pearls and had a golden cup in her hand filled with abominations and with the impurity and sacrilegious nature of her fornication. %u@5There was a name written on her forehead—a mystery: “Babylon the Great, the mother of fornicators and prostitutes and of the abominations of the Earth.” %u@6I saw the woman intoxicated from drinking the blood of the set-apart-people and the blood of those who make statements about Jesus.%vn~
      Upon seeing her, I was stupefied gawking at her. %u@7The angel told me, “What are you gawking at? I’ll explain to you the mystery of the woman and the beast that’s bearing her, the one with the seven heads and the ten horns. %u@8The beast which you saw came up out of the abyss in the past, is not out of the abyss at the present, but is about to come up out of the abyss, and is headed to its own demise. The existing inhabitants of the Earth who don’t have their names written in the Book of Life from the beginning of time seeing the beast will be amazed, because the beast came up out of the abyss in the past, is not out of it at present, but will be showing up some time in the future.%vn~
          %u@9Here’s something for a person who has a mind for intrigue: the seven heads are mountains where the woman is sitting. These are seven kings. %u@1%u@0Five have fallen, one still exists, the other hasn’t come into being yet, but when he does in fact come into being, he must remain a little while. %u@1%u@1The beast which came in the past and isn’t present now: it’s the eighth and comes out of the seven, and is headed to its own demise. %u@1%u@2The ten horns that you saw are ten kings who haven’t gotten a kingdom yet, but instead receive from the beast authority as kings for one hour. %u@1%u@3These guys have one purpose, and they give their power and authority to the beast. %u@1%u@4These guys will go to war with the lamb, and the lamb will conquer them, since he is Lord of Lords and King of Kings, and so will those with him: the called, the chosen, the faithful.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5He then says to me, “The waters that you saw the harlot sitting on: they are cluster after cluster of folk-people, are nations, and are those who share a common dialect. %u@1%u@6The ten horns which you saw, and the beast included: these guys hate the harlot and will strip her bare and have her for lunch. %u@1%u@7The fact is, God will cause them to willingly do His purpose, and that purpose is towards one goal only: to give their kingdom to the beast, until such a time that God’s ideas be completed. %u@1%u@8And the woman which you saw is the Great City which has a kingdom built upon the kings of the Earth.%vn~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 18%hb~
          %u@1After these things happened, I saw another angel come down out of the sky, one who has great authority and power, and the Earth was illuminated by his majestic splendor. %u@2He cried out in a loud voice,%vn~
%si~
Fallen! Fallen is Babylon the Great!%vp~
She has become the haunt of harassing spirits%vp~
And a prison of all filthy, disgusting spirits%vp~
And a prison of all filthy, disgusting birds%vp~
And a prison of all filthy, disgusting beasts%vp~
And of all things people have come to hate,%vp~
%u@3Because all the nations have gotten drunk%vp~
On the wine of her fornication,%vp~
And the kings of the Earth have fornicated with her,%vp~
And the merchants of the Earth have gotten rich%vp~
Off the powerful allure of her revelry in luxury.%vp~
%si~
%u@4And I heard another voice speaking from the sky,%nn~
%si~
Come out, my people, from her%vp~
So that you don’t partner with her,%vp~
Participating in her sins,%vp~
And that you don’t receive a dose of her plagues,%vp~
%u@5Because her sins have piled up%vp~
All the way to the sky,%vp~
And God has remembered her wrong-doings.%vp~
%si~
%u@6Pay her back the way she dished it out to you,%vp~
And up the ante according to her deeds.%vp~
Using the same cup she did her mixing in,%vp~
Mix a cocktail for her which is twice as concentrated.%vp~
%u@7So much as it glorified her%vp~
And made her revel in luxury,%vp~
Give such torment and mourning as that to her.%vp~
%si~
Because in her heart she tells herself,%vp~
“I’ve been awarded the status of queen%vp~
And am not a destitute widow,%vp~
There’s no way at all that I’ll experience mourning”—%vp~
%u@8On account of this,%vp~
Her plagues will arrive in one day:%vp~
Death, mourning, and famine.%vp~
She’ll be purged thoroughly by fire%vp~
Because the Lord God is mighty%vp~
Who judges her.%vp~
%si~
          %u@9The kings of the Earth will weep and thump their chests in mourning over her, those who fornicated with her and reveled in her luxury, when they eventually see the smoke of her conflagration, %u@1%u@0while standing far back because they’re terrified of her torment, saying,%vn~
%si~
Woe! Woe to the Great City!%vp~
The Mighty City Babylon—%vp~
Because your judgment arrived in one hour.%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@1The merchants of the Earth will then cry and mourn over her, because no one will buy their inventory any longer, %u@1%u@2inventory of gold, of silver, of gemstones, of pearls, of fine linen, of purple, of scarlet, of the fruit of the citron tree, of all sorts of chests made of ivory, of all sorts of chests made of expensive wood, of copper, of iron, of marble… %u@1%u@3and cinnamon, exotic spice plants, incense, myrrh, frankincense, wine, olive oil, fine wheat flour, wheat, beasts of burden, sheep, horses, chariots, slaves who do manual labor, slaves in general.%vn~
%si~
%u@1%u@4And the large pieces of fruit that come in late-summer%vp~
Consisting of your soul’s desire%vp~
Departed from you,%vp~
And all the sumptuous and splendid things%vp~
Disintegrated right in front of you.%vp~
These things will no longer be found—%vp~
No—not a chance.%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@5Those who trade in these things, the merchants who got rich off her, will stand far back because they’re terrified of her torment, %u@1%u@6saying,%nn~
%si~
Woe! Woe to the Great City!%vp~
Clothed in fine linen, in luxurious scarlet,%vp~
In the purple clothing that the wealthy wear,%vp~
And adorned in gold, in gemstones, and in pearls%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@7…Because in one hour such wealth will be wiped out. And every helmsmen and everyone who works the docks and sailors and whoever works in the boating industry stood far back %u@1%u@8and, upon seeing the smoke of her conflagration, shouted, “Have you ever seen anyone annihilated the same way as the Great City was?” %u@1%u@9Weeping and mourning, they poured dirt on their heads and cried out,%nn~
%si~
Woe! Woe to the Great City!%vp~
Everyone who put ships out to sea got rich%vp~
Off her aggrandized worth,%vp~
Because in one hour she has been wiped out.%vp~
%u@2%u@0Rejoice over her, sky and heaven%vp~
And saints, apostles, and prophets,%vp~
Because the justice that we’re owed from her,%vp~
God in His judgment has applied to her.%vp~
%si~
          %u@2%u@1An angel who is strong took a stone the size of a large millstone and slammed it into the sea saying,%vn~
%si~
In the same kind of swift, sudden, convulsive slam%vp~
As this stone was thrown%vp~
Babylon the Great City too has been slammed%vp~
And has not yet been found—not a trace.%vp~
%u@2%u@2And any sound of harp players%vp~
And their accompanying band of musicians%vp~
And flute players and trumpet players%vp~
And every artisan from every form of art%vp~
Could not be found—even a trace—%vp~
Still holding performances in you,%vp~
And the sound of any millstone still grinding%vp~
Could not be heard in you—not even a trace,%vp~
%u@2%u@3And a lamp’s light%vp~
Won’t shine yet again in you—%vp~
Not a chance,%vp~
And the sound of a bride and groom together%vp~
Won’t be heard yet again in you—%vp~
Not a chance.%vp~
%si~
And this because your merchants were%vp~
The top deal-makers of the Earth,%vp~
Because in your drug-induced sprees,%vp~
All the nations have been deceived by you,%vp~
And you have led them down the primrose path.%vp~
%u@2%u@4The prophets’ and saints’ blood%vp~
Has been found in her, and the blood%vp~
Of all those who’ve been slain upon the Earth.%vp~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 19%hb~
          %u@1After these things happened, I heard what sounded like the voice of an enormous crowd in heaven saying,%vn~
%si~
Hallelujah! (praise be to God)%vp~
For protecting us,%vp~
For the glory and the power of our God,%vp~
%u@2Because His judgments are absolutely correct in their truth,%vp~
Because He’s judged the Great Harlot%vp~
Who ruined the Earth%vp~
By polluting it with her fornication%vp~
And avenged the blood of His servants%vp~
Which was shed by her hand.%vp~
%si~
%u@3They completed what they had spoken by speaking a second time,%nn~
%si~
Hallelujah!%vp~
Her smoke billows up and billows up forever and ever.%vp~
%si~
%u@4And the twenty-four elders and the four creatures fell and worshiped the Almighty God who sits on the throne, saying,%nn~
%si~
The end at last: Hallelujah!%vp~
%si~
%u@5And a voice issued forth from the throne saying,%nn~
%si~
Praise our God%vp~
All His servants%vp~
And all who reverence Him,%vp~
The insignificant and the important%vp~
%si~
%u@6And I heard the sound of something like a large crowd and like the sound of a large volume of rushing water and like the sound of strong thunder saying,%nn~
%si~
Hallelujah,%vp~
Because our Lord God Almighty reigns.%vp~
%u@7Let us rejoice and be glad%vp~
And give Him the glory,%vp~
Because the time has arrived for the lamb’s marriage,%vp~
And his bride-to-be has prepared herself,%vp~
%u@8And she was given bright, clean, fine linen to put on:%vp~
You see, the linen is the righteous deeds%vp~
Of the set-apart-people.%vp~
%si~
          %u@9He then tells me, “Write this down: Blessed are those who’ve been invited to the lamb’s marriage dinner.”%vn~
      He continues, “These words are truly from God.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@0I fell before His feet to worship Him. He then tells me, “Get ahold of yourself. I’m a fellow-servant of yours and of your comrades who keep the statement of Jesus. Worship God, not me. You see, the official statement about Jesus is the underlying impetus of prophecy.”%vn~
          %u@1%u@1I saw the sky while it had been opened, and—like that—a white horse and mounted on it one called Ever True to His Faithful Nature, and he judges and wages war righteously. %u@1%u@2His eyes are like wheels of fire, and upon his head are many ornamental headbands, having names of his attributes, accomplishments, and titles written on them which nobody knows except he himself, %u@1%u@3and clothed in clothing that has been soaked in blood, and the name that he goes by is the Word of God. %u@1%u@4The soldier-garrison in heaven followed him on white horses, clothed in clean, fine white linen. %u@1%u@5Out of his mouth protrudes a sharp Thracian sword, and it’s there so that he can strike the nations, and he personally shepherds (rules) them with a staff of iron. He himself treads the winepress of the wine of the ferocious wrath of God Almighty. %u@1%u@6He has a name written on his outer garment and on his thigh: King of Kings and Lord of Lords.%vn~
          %u@1%u@7I saw an angel up in the upper atmosphere blocking the sun. He shouted in a loud voice telling any bird that’s capable of flying at a high altitude, “Come gather yourselves for God’s Great Dinner, %u@1%u@8so that you get the chance to eat the meat of kings, of commanders, of mighty people, of horses and those mounted on them, of free men and not just them but of slaves, of the insignificant, and of the great.” %u@1%u@9And I saw the beast and the kings of the Earth and their soldiers gathered for the purpose of waging war against the one mounted on the horse and his troops.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0And the beast was seized and with him the false prophet too, the one who performs miracles under his supervision, by such miracles he’s deceived those who’ve received the mark of the beast and those who worship his replica—the pair were thrown alive into the Lake of Fire, the lake burning in brimstone. %u@2%u@1The remainder were killed by the Thracian sword that comes out of the mouth of the one mounted on the horse, and all of the previously mentioned birds ate their flesh until they were too full to eat anymore.%vn~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 20%hb~
          %u@1I saw an angel come down out of the sky with the key to the abyss on him and with a huge chain in his hand, %u@2and he grabbed the dragon, the Ancient Serpent who is a slanderer—yes, Satan—tied him up with the chain for a thousand years, %u@3tossed him into the abyss, locked it, and covered the top over and secured it so that he couldn’t deceive the nations anymore until the thousand years were up. After that, he must be set free for a little while.%vn~
          %u@4I saw some thrones, and I saw those who were seated on them. They were assigned the task of presiding in judgment over the crimes perpetrated against the lives of those who had been beheaded on account of the statement of Jesus and the word of God and perpetrated against whoever wouldn’t worship the beast or his replica and wouldn’t receive the mark upon their foreheads and their hands. And they lived and reigned with the Messiah (the Christ) a thousand years. %u@5The rest of the dead weren’t brought back to life until the thousand years was over. That’s the First Life-after-Death Epoch. %u@6The person who takes part in the First Life-after-Death Epoch is blessed and holy; the second change of bodily state of being has no power over these people, but instead they’ll be personal attendants of God and of the Messiah, and they will reign with him for a thousand years.%vn~
          %u@7But when the thousand years finally does end, Satan will be let out of jail. %u@8He’ll be set free to commit an act of deception upon the nations even to the farthest reach of the planet—all the way to Timbuktu—to gather them together for the War. There were gathered as many as the number of grains of sand on a typical seashore. %u@9As an army they deployed themselves in such a way as to occupy and control all the key territory and surrounded the saints’ home base, which is the Beloved City—And flames came down from out of the sky and devoured them. %u@1%u@0“The Slanderer”—the Devil, the one deceiving them—was thrown into the lake of fire and brimstone, where the beast and the false prophet are too, and they will be tormented day and night forever and ever.%vn~
          %u@1%u@1I saw a great white throne and the One seated on it, One whom the Earth fled from the fierceness and intensity of His undivided attention—and they found no place to escape it. %u@1%u@2I saw the spiritually dead who had died previously, the insignificant and the important, made to stand before the throne, and many books were opened, and apart from them another book was opened, which is called the Book of Life. And the dead were judged from what had been written in the many books, judged, that is, according to the deeds they had committed. %u@1%u@3The graveyard coughed up its dead—the Grim Reaper returned his dead indeed—and each was judged according to his deeds. %u@1%u@4And the Grim Reaper was thrown into the Lake of Fire. %u@1%u@5And if any given person’s name wasn’t found written in the Book of Life, he was thrown into the Lake of Fire.%vn~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 21%hb~
          %u@1I saw brand-new sky and brand-new ground, seeing that the original sky and the original ground had disappeared and that the sea didn’t exist anymore. %u@2I saw the Holy City of Jerusalem—a brand-new one—coming down out of the sky, coming from heaven, from God, gotten ready like a bride who put on her best dress along with her best jewelry, her best face, and arranged her hair in the best way in preparation of being joined to her husband-to-be. %u@3I heard a loud voice from the throne saying, “Look—God’s setting up camp with mankind. He will camp out with them, and they will be His very own people, %u@4and He’ll wipe every tear from their eyes, and Death will not exist, nor will mourning, nor the screaming of anguish, nor will the pains of labor exist: the original stuff is gone.%vn~
          %u@5The One seated on the throne said, “See here—I’m remaking and redoing everything.” He continued, “Write this down, since these very words are ever true in their faithfulness.” %u@6He told me, “It has come into being. I am the A-to-Z, the beginning and the end. To him who thirsts, I allow to drink from the spring of the water of life, no strings attached. %u@7The one who triumphs in perseverance will inherit these things. I will be a god-figure to him and he will be a son to me. %u@8Now as far as the cowardly, the worthless, the detestable, the murderers, the fornicators, the recreational drug-users, the idolaters, and all liars are concerned, they wind up in the lake which burns with fire and brimstone, which is the Second Death, the second bodily transformation of the disobedient.%vn~
          %u@9One of the seven angels (the angels who have the seven bowls filled with the final seven plagues) came and conversed with me saying, “Come and I’ll show you the lamb’s wife-to-be, his bride.” %u@1%u@0In the Spirit he took me and put me on a huge, tall mountain and showed me the holy city Jerusalem coming down out of heaven from God, %u@1%u@1having God’s glory. It was glimmering and radiating light like a gemstone does, like crystal-clear jasper, %u@1%u@2and had large, tall walls, twelve gates and twelve angels at each gate, and names inscribed on the gates that are from the twelve tribes of the sons of Israel. %u@1%u@3Three gates face east, three face north, three face south, and three face west. %u@1%u@4The city wall has twelve underlying bands of enormous stones which serve as its foundations, and upon them are the names of the twelve apostles of the lamb.%vn~
          %u@1%u@5The angel who was conversing with me had a golden measuring stick, so that he could measure the city, its gates, and its walls. %u@1%u@6The city is laid in a square, and its length and width are the same. Using the measuring stick, he measured the city to be 1500 miles/2400 km long, and the width and the height are the same as the length. %u@1%u@7He measured its wall to be 215 ft/66 m high, in terms of human units of measurement, which is the same units that angels use. %u@1%u@8Its surrounding wall is jasper, and the city is pure gold like a clear glass. %u@1%u@9The foundation of the city walls is decorated with every kind of precious stone and gemstone imaginable. The first foundation is jasper, the second is sapphire, the third is agate, the fourth is emerald, %u@2%u@0the fifth is onyx, the sixth is ruby, the seventh is chrysolite, the eighth is beryl, the ninth is topaz, the tenth is turquoise, the eleventh is jacinth, the twelfth is amethyst. %u@2%u@1The twelve gates are twelve pearls, and each gate is made out of a single pearl. The main street of the city is pure gold like transparent glass.%vn~
          %u@2%u@2I saw that there was no temple in it, since the Lord God Almighty is its temple, and so is the lamb. %u@2%u@3The city has no need to be illuminated by the light of the sun and the moon, since God’s glory shines on it and illuminates it, and the lamb is its lamp. %u@2%u@4The nations will be able to see clearly to walk about as a result of the city’s light, and the kings of the Earth bring their glory to it, contributing their very best to it. %u@2%u@5Its gates will never, ever shut because it’ll be daytime all the time, seeing that there will be no nighttime, %u@2%u@6and they will bring the very best things nations possess and their valuable artifacts into it. %u@2%u@7And there’s no way whatsoever that any sort of base, degenerate being will enter, nor will any being who lies about doing detestable things—only those who’ve been written in the lamb’s Book of Life may enter.%vn~
%sb~
Revelation Chapter 22%hb~
          %u@1He then showed me a river of living water as clear as crystal, pouring out of God’s throne and out of the lamb %u@2and into the middle of the city’s main street. The tree of life yields fruit on either side of the river twelve times a year, each month, and the tree’s leaves are destined for the treatment and healing of the nations. %u@3No kind of curse (bad things which happen to people) will exist anymore. God’s throne will be in the city, and so will the lamb, and His servants will ritualistically offer up a service of worship to Him. %u@4His face will be visible, and His name will be seen upon their foreheads. %u@5There will no longer be any night, and there won’t be any need for lamplight and sunlight, because the Lord God will provide illumination for them and will reign forever and ever.%vn~
          %u@6He told me, “These here words are ever true in their faithfulness.”%vn~
      The Lord, the God of the prophetic utterances of the prophets, sent His angel to show His servants what must come to pass post-haste.%vn~
%si~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@7%R@S%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@—%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@B%r@l%r@e%r@s%r@s%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@i%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@h%r@o%r@ %r@k%r@e%r@e%r@p%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@s%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@p%r@r%r@o%r@p%r@h%r@e%r@c%r@y%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@s%r@ %r@s%r@c%r@r%r@o%r@l%r@l%r@.%r@%vp~
%si~
          %u@8And, I, John, the one who’s listening to and watching all these things—when I heard and saw this, I fell on my face before the feet of the angel who’s showing me these things to worship him. %u@9He then tells me, “Get ahold of yourself. I’m a fellow-servant of yours, of your comrades the prophets, and of those adhering to the words in this scroll. Worship God, not me.” %u@1%u@0He then tells me, “Don’t deny access to the prophetic words in this scroll, seeing that the time is near. %u@1%u@1Let he who behaves in a worthless manner yet continue in his worthlessness, let he who is foul yet continue to be foul and filthy, let he who’s righteous yet continue to act righteously, and he who’s holy yet continue to act like a saint.%vn~
%si~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@2%R@S%r@e%r@e%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@r%r@e%r@—%R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@v%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@a%r@s%r@h%r@ %r@o%r@n%r@ %r@h%r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@p%r@a%r@y%r@ %r@e%r@a%r@c%r@h%r@ %r@p%r@e%r@r%r@s%r@o%r@n%r@ %r@a%r@c%r@c%r@o%r@r%r@d%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@w%r@o%r@r%r@k%r@ %r@h%r@e%r@’%r@s%r@ %r@d%r@o%r@n%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@o%r@r%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@a%r@y%r@.%r@ %r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@3%R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@A%r@-%R@Z%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@f%r@i%r@r%r@s%r@t%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@l%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@,%r@ %r@b%r@e%r@g%r@i%r@n%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@a%r@n%r@d%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@e%r@n%r@d%r@.%r@%vp~
%si~
          %u@1%u@4Blessed are those who wash their robes, so they have the right to the tree of life; and when they perchance desire to enter the city, they are permitted to use the gates. %u@1%u@5Outside the city are the dogs, the recreational drug users, the fornicators, the murderers, the idolaters, and everyone who is quite fond of lying and lies all the time.%vn~
%si~
%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@1%r@%%r@u%r@@%r@6%R@I%r@,%r@ %R@J%r@e%r@s%r@u%r@s%r@,%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@s%r@p%r@a%r@t%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@d%r@ %r@m%r@y%r@ %r@a%r@g%r@e%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@d%r@e%r@c%r@l%r@a%r@r%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@e%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@s%r@ %r@t%r@o%r@ %r@y%r@o%r@u%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@c%r@h%r@u%r@r%r@c%r@h%r@e%r@s%r@.%r@ %R@I%r@ %r@a%r@m%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %r@d%r@i%r@r%r@e%r@c%r@t%r@-%r@d%r@e%r@s%r@c%r@e%r@n%r@d%r@a%r@n%r@t%r@ %r@o%r@f%r@ %R@D%r@a%r@v%r@i%r@d%r@,%r@ %r@t%r@h%r@e%r@ %R@B%r@r%r@i%r@g%r@h%r@t%r@ %R@M%r@o%r@r%r@n%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %R@S%r@t%r@a%r@r%r@.%r@ %r@%vp~
%si~
%u@1%u@7And the Spirit and the bride-to-be say, “Come!” And let the one who thirsts come, and let the one who so desires freely partake of the water of life.%nn~
          %u@1%u@8I confirm that I’ve heard all the prophetic words which are in this scroll. If anyone chooses to add to them, God will add all the plagues that are written in this scroll to his life. %u@1%u@9And if anyone chooses to delete words from this prophetic scroll, God will delete his access to the tree of life and to the holy city, which has been written about in this scroll.%vn~
          %u@2%u@0He who confirms these things says:%vn~
%si~
%r@“%R@Y%r@e%r@s%r@ %r@i%r@n%r@d%r@e%r@e%r@d%r@,%r@ %R@I%r@’%r@m%r@ %r@c%r@o%r@m%r@i%r@n%r@g%r@ %r@p%r@o%r@s%r@t%r@-%r@h%r@a%r@s%r@t%r@e%r@.%r@”%vp~
%vp~
      Let it be so. Come Lord Jesus.%vn~
%si~
          %u@2%u@1May the grace of the Lord Jesus be with everyone.%vn~
